RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [GENOMIC DNA].
RA   Kuch U., Molles B.E., Cederlund E., Alvelius G., Joernvall H.,
RA   Bergman T., Chanhome L., Omori-Satoh T., Chen Y.M., Samejima Y.,
RA   Warrell D.A., Mebs D.;
RT   "Alpha-delta-bungarotoxin, a novel reversible long-chain neurotoxin
RT   from Malayan krait (Bungarus candidus) venom with high toxicity and

RN   [2]
RP   PROTEIN SEQUENCE OF 3-75, FUNCTION, SUBCELLULAR LOCATION, MASS
RP   SPECTROMETRY, AND TOXIC DOSE.
RC   TISSUE=Venom;
RA   Kuch U., Cederlund E., Molles B.E., Anvelius G., Bergman T.,
RA   Chanhome L., Omori-Satoh T., Chen Y.M., Samejima Y., Warrell D.A.,
RA   Mebs D.;
RT   "A novel reversible long-chain neurotoxin from Malayan krait (Bungarus
RT   candidus) venom with high toxicity and site-selective binding at the
RT   alpha-delta subunit interface of the muscle nicotinic acetylcholine
RT   receptor.";
RL   Submitted (FEB-2005) to UniProtKB.
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Binds with high affinity to muscular (alpha-1/CHRNA1)
CC       and neuronal (alpha-7/CHRNA7) nicotinic acetylcholine receptor
CC       (nAChR) and inhibits acetylcholine from binding to the receptor,
CC       thereby impairing neuromuscular and neuronal transmission (By
CC       similarity). Competitive antagonist of nicotinic acetylcholine
CC       receptors. Binds reversibly to chick and mouse muscle nicotinic
CC       acetylcholine receptors. Preferentially binds to alpha-delta
CC       subunit interface of the adult mouse muscle nicotinic
CC       acetylcholine receptor. {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:P60615,
CC       ECO:0000269|Ref.2}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Monomer in solution, homodimer in crystal state.
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:P60615}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted {ECO:0000269|Ref.2}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed by the venom gland. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- MASS SPECTROMETRY: Mass=8030.50; Method=Electrospray; Range=3-75;
CC       Evidence={ECO:0000269|Ref.2};
CC   -!- TOXIC DOSE: LD(50) is 0.28 mg/g by intraperitoneal injection into
CC       mice. {ECO:0000269|Ref.2}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the snake three-finger toxin family. Long-
CC       chain subfamily. Type II alpha-neurotoxin sub-subfamily.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.

ID   3SX1_DENPO              Reviewed;          78 AA.
AC   P0DKR6; B3EWQ5; K0C0K0;
DT   28-NOV-2012, integrated into UniProtKB/Swiss-Prot.
DT   28-NOV-2012, sequence version 1.
DT   27-MAY-2015, entry version 14.
DE   RecName: Full=Mambalgin-1 {ECO:0000303|PubMed:23034652};
DE            Short=Mamb-1;
DE   AltName: Full=Pi-Dp1;
DE   Flags: Precursor;
OS   Dendroaspis polylepis polylepis (Black mamba).
OC   Eukaryota; Metazoa; Chordata; Craniata; Vertebrata; Euteleostomi;
OC   Lepidosauria; Squamata; Bifurcata; Unidentata; Episquamata;
OC   Toxicofera; Serpentes; Colubroidea; Elapidae; Elapinae; Dendroaspis.
OX   NCBI_TaxID=8620;
RN   [1]
RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [MRNA], PROTEIN SEQUENCE OF 22-78, FUNCTION,
RP   BIOASSAY, PHARMACEUTICAL, MASS SPECTROMETRY, 3D-STRUCTURE MODELING,
RP   AND SUBCELLULAR LOCATION.
RC   TISSUE=Venom, and Venom gland;
RX   PubMed=23034652; DOI=10.1038/nature11494;
RA   Diochot S., Baron A., Salinas M., Douguet D., Scarzello S.,
RA   Dabert-Gay A.-S., Debayle D., Friend V., Alloui A., Lazdunski M.,
RA   Lingueglia E.;
RT   "Black mamba venom peptides target acid-sensing ion channels to
RT   abolish pain.";
RL   Nature 490:552-555(2012).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: This three-finger toxin shows a potent analgesic effect
CC       against acute and inflammatory pain upon central and peripheral
CC       injection. It acts through a reversible block of the heteromeric
CC       channel ASIC1a-ASIC2a (ACCN2-ACCN1) in central neurons and of
CC       ASIC1b-containing channels in nociceptors. Acts as a gating
CC       modifier toxin by binding to the closed/inactivated channel. On
CC       channels expressed in COS-7 cells, it shows IC(50) of: 55 nM on
CC       rASIC1a, 127 nM on hASIC1a, 246 nM on rASIC1a-rASIC2a, 61 nM on
CC       rASIC1a-rASIC2b, 192 nM on ASIC1b, and 72 nM on rASIC1a-rASIC1b.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:23034652}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted {ECO:0000269|PubMed:23034652}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed by the venom gland. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- MASS SPECTROMETRY: Mass=6555.7; Method=MALDI; Range=22-78;
CC       Note=Average mass.; Evidence={ECO:0000269|PubMed:23034652};
CC   -!- PHARMACEUTICAL: Promising peptide that shows a potent analgesic
CC       effect against acute and inflammatory pain that can be as strong
CC       as morphine but resistant to naloxone, with much less tolerance
CC       and no respiratory distress.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: Has no effect on ASIC2a (ACCN1), ASIC3 (ACCN3),
CC       ASIC1a-ASIC3 (ACCN2-ACCN3) and ASIC1b-ASIC3 (ACCN2-ACCN3)
CC       channels, as well as on TRPV1, P2RX2 (P2X2), HTR3A (5-HT3A),
CC       Nav1.8 (SCN10A), Cav3.2 (CACNA1H) and Kv1.2 (KCNA2) channels. Does
CC       not produce motor dysfunction, apathy, flaccid paralysis,
CC       convulsions or death upon central injections (intrathecal or
CC       intracerebroventricular) in mice (PubMed:23034652).
CC       {ECO:0000305|PubMed:23034652}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the snake three-finger toxin family. Short-
CC       chain subfamily. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------
CC   Copyrighted by the UniProt Consortium, see http://www.uniprot.org/terms
CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------

RL   Carbohydr. Res. 338:219-230(2003).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Hydrolyzes galactooligomers with a degree of
CC       polymerization higher than 3. Hydrolyzes radish root
CC       arabinogalactan-protein. Does not hydrolyze dextran, arabinan,
CC       starch, laminarin, beta-1,4- and beta-1,3-galactans, larch wood
CC       arabinogalactan or acid-insoluble polygalacturonic acid.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12543554, ECO:0000269|PubMed:14565843}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Endohydrolysis of (1->6)-beta-D-galactosidic
CC       linkages in arabinogalactan proteins and (1->3):(1->6)-beta-
CC       galactans to yield galactose and beta-(1->6)-galactaobiose as the
CC       final products. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12543554,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:14565843}.
CC   -!- BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES:
CC       pH dependence:
CC         Optimum pH is 4.3. Stable between pH 3.0 and 11.0 in the
CC         presence of BSA, and pH 4.0 and 9.5 in the absence of BSA.
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12543554};
CC       Temperature dependence:
CC         Loses 30% of activity after 10 minutes incubation at 50 degrees
CC         Celsius, activity is abolished after 10 minutes incubation at 60
CC         degrees Celsius. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12543554};
CC   -!- MASS SPECTROMETRY: Mass=50687.4; Method=MALDI; Range=21-479;
CC       Evidence={ECO:0000269|PubMed:14565843};

CC       family. {ECO:0000305}.

RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [MRNA], PROTEIN SEQUENCE OF 31-41; 126-138;
RP   141-152 AND 300-311, FUNCTION, CATALYTIC ACTIVITY, PATHWAY,
RP   BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES, SUBCELLULAR LOCATION, TISSUE
RP   SPECIFICITY, DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE, AND DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE.
RC   TISSUE=Petal;
RX   PubMed=20971893; DOI=10.1105/tpc.110.077487;
RA   Matsuba Y., Sasaki N., Tera M., Okamura M., Abe Y., Okamoto E.,
RA   Nakamura H., Funabashi H., Takatsu M., Saito M., Matsuoka H.,
RA   Nagasawa K., Ozeki Y.;
RT   "A novel glucosylation reaction on anthocyanins catalyzed by acyl-
RT   glucose-dependent glucosyltransferase in the petals of carnation and
RT   delphinium.";
RL   Plant Cell 22:3374-3389(2010).
RN   [2]
RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [GENOMIC DNA], AND DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE.
RX   PubMed=22048706; DOI=10.1007/s00438-011-0655-7;
RA   Nishizaki Y., Matsuba Y., Okamoto E., Okamura M., Ozeki Y., Sasaki N.;
RT   "Structure of the acyl-glucose-dependent anthocyanin 5-O-
RT   glucosyltransferase gene in carnations and its disruption by
RT   transposable elements in some varieties.";
RL   Mol. Genet. Genomics 286:383-394(2011).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Beta-glycosidase that catalyzes the transfer of glucose
CC       moiety to anthocyanidin 3-glucoside at the 5 position.
CC       Anthocyanins are ubiquitous colored pigments that are responsible
CC       for variations in petal color. Uses acyl-glucoses, but not UDP-
CC       glucose, as the glucose donor. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:20971893}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: 1-O-sinapoyl-beta-D-glucose + cyanidin 3-O-
CC       beta-D-glucoside = sinapate + cyanidin 3,5-di-O-beta-D-glucoside.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:20971893}.
CC   -!- BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES:
CC       Kinetic parameters:
CC         KM=13 mM for cyanidin 3-glucopyranoside (with native enzyme at
CC         pH 5.0 and 30 degrees Celsius) {ECO:0000269|PubMed:20971893};
CC         KM=46.5 mM for 1-O-beta-D-vanillyl-glucose (with native enzyme
CC         at pH 5.0 and 30 degrees Celsius) {ECO:0000269|PubMed:20971893};
CC         KM=6.5 mM for cyanidin 3-glucopyranoside (with recombinant
CC         enzyme at pH 5.0 and 30 degrees Celsius)
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:20971893};
CC         KM=51.9 mM for 1-O-beta-D-vanillyl-glucose (with recombinant
CC         enzyme at pH 5.0 and 30 degrees Celsius)
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:20971893};
CC         Note=Kcat is 0.06 sec(-1) with cyanidin 3-glucopyranoside (with
CC         native enzyme at pH 5.0 and 30 degrees Celsius). Kcat is 0.01
CC         sec(-1) with 1-O-beta-D-vanillyl-glucose (with native enzyme at
CC         pH 5.0 and 30 degrees Celsius). Kcat is 0.07 sec(-1) with
CC         cyanidin 3-glucopyranoside (with recombinant enzyme at pH 5.0
CC         and 30 degrees Celsius). Kcat is 0.01 sec(-1) with 1-O-beta-D-
CC         vanillyl-glucose (with recombinant enzyme at pH 5.0 and 30
CC         degrees Celsius).;
CC       pH dependence:
CC         Optimum pH is 4.5-5.0. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:20971893};
CC       Temperature dependence:
CC         Optimum temperature is 48 degrees Celsius.
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:20971893};
CC   -!- PATHWAY: Pigment biosynthesis; anthocyanin biosynthesis.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:20971893}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Vacuole {ECO:0000269|PubMed:20971893}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed in petals.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:20971893}.
CC   -!- DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE: Expression peaks at stage 2 of petal
CC       development. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:20971893}.
CC   -!- DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Petal color variations. Petals accumulate
CC       anthocyanin lacking the glucosyl moiety at the 5 position.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:20971893, ECO:0000269|PubMed:22048706}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the glycosyl hydrolase 1 family.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.

CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Alpha-L-arabinofuranosidase involved in the degradation
CC       of arabinoxylan, a major component of plant hemicellulose. Acts

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Alpha-L-arabinofuranosidase involved in the degradation
CC       of arabinoxylan, a major component of plant hemicellulose. Acts
CC       only on small linear 1,5-alpha-linked L-arabinofuranosyl
CC       oligosaccharides. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16233515}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Hydrolysis of terminal non-reducing alpha-L-
CC       arabinofuranoside residues in alpha-L-arabinosides.
CC   -!- BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES:

CC         Optimum pH is 4.0. Stable between pH 3.0 and 7.0.
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16233515};
CC       Temperature dependence:
CC         Optimum temperature is 55 degrees Celsius.
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16233515};

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Secreted alpha-L-arabinofuranosidase that actively
CC       hydrolyzes p-NP-alpha-L-arabinofuranoside. Exhibits significant
CC       activity against polymeric arabinose-containing substrates such as
CC       arabinan and arabinoxylan. Hydrolyzes also low-molecular-weight
CC       and polymeric galactoside-containing substrates such as galactan,
CC       xyloglycan, and p-NP-beta-D-galactopyranoside.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:14640962}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Hydrolysis of terminal non-reducing alpha-L-
CC       arabinofuranoside residues in alpha-L-arabinosides.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:14640962}.
CC   -!- BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES:
CC       pH dependence:
CC         Optimum pH is 5.5. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:14640962};
CC       Temperature dependence:
CC         Optimum temperature is 67 degrees Celsius. 50 perscent maximal
CC         activity is exhibited at 75 degrees Celsius. Reaction time was
CC         10 min. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:14640962};
CC   -!- PATHWAY: Glycan metabolism; L-arabinan degradation.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted {ECO:0000269|PubMed:14640962,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:24211368}.
CC   -!- PTM: Residues Asn-28, Asn-85, Asn-180, Asn-252, and Asn-559 are
CC       highly mannosylated with up to 7 mannose residues.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:24211368}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the glycosyl hydrolase 51 family.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Secreted alpha-L-arabinofuranosidase that actively
CC       hydrolyzes p-NP-alpha-L-arabinofuranoside and is specific for
CC       furanose configuration of the carbohydrate ring. Exhibits also
CC       significant activity against polymeric arabinose-containing
CC       substrates such as arabinan and arabinoxylan, a major component of
CC       plant hemicellulose. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:14640962}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Hydrolysis of terminal non-reducing alpha-L-
CC       arabinofuranoside residues in alpha-L-arabinosides.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:14640962}.
CC   -!- BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES:
CC       pH dependence:
CC         Optimum pH is 4.7. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:14640962};
CC       Temperature dependence:
CC         Optimum temperature is 70 degrees Celsius. 50 perscent maximal
CC         activity is exhibited at 75 degrees Celsius. Reaction time was
CC         10 min. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:14640962};
CC   -!- PATHWAY: Glycan metabolism; L-arabinan degradation.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted {ECO:0000269|PubMed:14640962,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:24211368}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: Organized into two domains: an N-terminal catalytic domain
CC       and a C-terminal arabinose-binding domain (ABD). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: Residue Asn-280 is mannosylated with up to 7 mannose
CC       residues. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:24211368}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the glycosyl hydrolase 54 family.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.

DE   RecName: Full=Antifreeze protein Maxi;

DE            Short=AFP Hyp-1;
DE   Flags: Precursor;
OS   Pseudopleuronectes americanus (Winter flounder) (Pleuronectes
OS   americanus).
OC   Eukaryota; Metazoa; Chordata; Craniata; Vertebrata; Euteleostomi;
OC   Actinopterygii; Neopterygii; Teleostei; Neoteleostei; Acanthomorphata;

RN   [1]
RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [MRNA], PROTEIN SEQUENCE OF 24-30, SIGNAL PEPTIDE,
RP   FUNCTION, SUBUNIT, AND TISSUE SPECIFICITY.
RC   TISSUE=Liver;
RX   PubMed=18225917; DOI=10.1021/bi7020316;

RT   binding sites.";
RL   Biochemistry 47:2051-2063(2008).
RN   [2]
RP   FUNCTION, SUBCELLULAR LOCATION, TISSUE SPECIFICITY, AND
RP   BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES.
RX   PubMed=15141201; DOI=10.1038/429153a;
RA   Marshall C.B., Fletcher G.L., Davies P.L.;
RT   "Hyperactive antifreeze protein in a fish.";
RL   Nature 429:153-153(2004).
RN   [3]
RP   PROTEIN SEQUENCE OF 24-35, SIGNAL PEPTIDE, FUNCTION, SUBUNIT,
RP   SUBCELLULAR LOCATION, TISSUE SPECIFICITY, AND BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL
RP   PROPERTIES.
RX   PubMed=15716269; DOI=10.1074/jbc.M500622200;
RA   Marshall C.B., Chakrabartty A., Davies P.L.;
RT   "Hyperactive antifreeze protein from winter flounder is a very long
RT   rod-like dimer of alpha-helices.";
RL   J. Biol. Chem. 280:17920-17929(2005).
RN   [4]
RP   X-RAY CRYSTALLOGRAPHY (1.8 ANGSTROMS) OF 24-218, FUNCTION, SUBUNIT,
RP   AND DOMAIN.
RX   PubMed=24531972; DOI=10.1126/science.1247407;
RA   Sun T., Lin F.H., Campbell R.L., Allingham J.S., Davies P.L.;
RT   "An antifreeze protein folds with an interior network of more than 400
RT   semi-clathrate waters.";
RL   Science 343:795-798(2014).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Contributes to protect fish blood from freezing at
CC       subzero sea water temperatures. Lowers the blood freezing point by
CC       about 1.1 degrees at a concentration of 0.1 mg/ml, and by about
CC       1.5 degrees at a concentration of 0.2 mg/ml. Binds to nascent ice
CC       crystals and prevents further growth.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15141201, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15716269,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:18225917, ECO:0000269|PubMed:24531972}.
CC   -!- BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES:
CC       Temperature dependence:
CC         Thermolabile, displays irreversible loss of activity and
CC         aggregation at room temperature. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15141201,
CC         ECO:0000269|PubMed:15716269};
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homodimer. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15716269,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:18225917, ECO:0000269|PubMed:24531972}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15141201,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:15716269}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Detected in blood serum (at protein level).
CC       Detected in liver. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15141201,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:15716269, ECO:0000269|PubMed:18225917}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The polypeptide has an alpha-hairpin structure. Two
CC       subunits dimerize to form a four-helix, rod-like structure. Each
CC       subunit is composed of a cap structure and of tandem 11 residue
CC       repeats with the sequence [TI]-X-X-X-A-X-X-X-A-X-X. Each repeat
CC       forms three helical turns with an average of 3.7 residues per
CC       turn, as opposed to 3.6 residues per turn for a classical alpha
CC       helix. Contrary to other proteins, where the protein core is
CC       stabilized by hydrophobic interactions and contains little water,
CC       this protein contains in its interior over 400 ordered water
CC       molecules with a semi-clathrate structure. Most likely, the
CC       interaction with the surface of ice crystals is mediated by bound
CC       water molecules that protrude between the helices.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:24531972}.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: The concentration in blood serum is about 0.2
CC       mg/ml.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the type-I AFP family. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- WEB RESOURCE: Name=Protein Spotlight; Note=It did it its way -
CC       Issue 162 of July 2014;
CC       URL="http://web.expasy.org/spotlight/back_issues/162/";
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------
CC   Copyrighted by the UniProt Consortium, see http://www.uniprot.org/terms
CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------

CC         ECO:0000269|PubMed:6986375};
CC         Vmax=42 umol/min/mg enzyme for L-asparagine
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:342521, ECO:0000269|PubMed:6986375};
CC         Vmax=60 umol/min/mg enzyme for D-asparagine
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:342521, ECO:0000269|PubMed:6986375};
CC         Vmax=167 umol/min/mg enzyme for N-acetyl-L-asparagine
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:342521, ECO:0000269|PubMed:6986375};
CC         Vmax=79 umol/min/mg enzyme for N-carbamyl-L-asparagine
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:342521, ECO:0000269|PubMed:6986375};
CC         Vmax=67 umol/min/mg enzyme for N-isoleucyl-L-asparagine
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:342521, ECO:0000269|PubMed:6986375};
CC         Vmax=135 umol/min/mg enzyme for N-glycyl-L-asparagine
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:342521, ECO:0000269|PubMed:6986375};
CC         Vmax=56 umol/min/mg enzyme for N-valyl-L-asparagine
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:342521, ECO:0000269|PubMed:6986375};
CC         Vmax=92 umol/min/mg enzyme for N-methionyl-L-asparagine
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:342521, ECO:0000269|PubMed:6986375};
CC         Vmax=8 umol/min/mg enzyme for N-glycyl-D-asparagine
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:342521, ECO:0000269|PubMed:6986375};
CC         Note=Does not act on isoasparagine, L-aspartate diamide, beta-
CC         alanine amide and L-glutamine.;
CC       pH dependence:
CC         Optimum pH is 6.8. Active from pH 5.5 to pH 7.5. Stable from pH
CC         3.5 to pH 10.5. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:342521,
CC         ECO:0000269|PubMed:6986375};
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted. Periplasm.
CC   -!- INDUCTION: Subject to nitrogen catabolite repression (NCR). Not
CC       found in cells grown on rich nitrogen sources like ammonia,
CC       glutamine or glutamate, but is found in cells that have been
CC       subjected to nitrogen starvation or have been grown on a poor
CC       nitrogen source such as proline. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:6995441}.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: Yeast contains 2 L-asparaginase isoenzymes:
CC       cytoplasmic L-asparaginase I, and cell wall L-asparaginase II.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: There are 4 copies for L-asparaginase 2 in yeast.
CC       The 4 identical copies ASP3-1, ASP3-2, ASP3-3 and ASP3-4 are
CC       arranged in tandem repeats located near a ribosomal DNA cluster.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the asparaginase 1 family. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 asparaginase/glutaminase domain.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU01068}.

CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:342521, ECO:0000269|PubMed:6986375};

CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:342521, ECO:0000269|PubMed:6986375};

CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:342521, ECO:0000269|PubMed:6986375};
CC         Vmax=79 umol/min/mg enzyme for N-carbamyl-L-asparagine
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:342521, ECO:0000269|PubMed:6986375};
CC         Vmax=67 umol/min/mg enzyme for N-isoleucyl-L-asparagine
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:342521, ECO:0000269|PubMed:6986375};
CC         Vmax=135 umol/min/mg enzyme for N-glycyl-L-asparagine
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:342521, ECO:0000269|PubMed:6986375};

CC         Vmax=92 umol/min/mg enzyme for N-methionyl-L-asparagine
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:342521, ECO:0000269|PubMed:6986375};
CC         Vmax=8 umol/min/mg enzyme for N-glycyl-D-asparagine
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:342521, ECO:0000269|PubMed:6986375};
CC         Note=Does not act on isoasparagine, L-aspartate diamide, beta-
CC         alanine amide and L-glutamine.;
CC       pH dependence:
CC         Optimum pH is 6.8. Active from pH 5.5 to pH 7.5. Stable from pH
CC         3.5 to pH 10.5. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:342521,
CC         ECO:0000269|PubMed:6986375};
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted. Periplasm.
CC   -!- INDUCTION: Subject to nitrogen catabolite repression (NCR). Not
CC       found in cells grown on rich nitrogen sources like ammonia,
CC       glutamine or glutamate, but is found in cells that have been
CC       subjected to nitrogen starvation or have been grown on a poor
CC       nitrogen source such as proline. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:6995441}.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: Yeast contains 2 L-asparaginase isoenzymes:
CC       cytoplasmic L-asparaginase I, and cell wall L-asparaginase II.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: There are 4 copies for L-asparaginase 2 in yeast.
CC       The 4 identical copies ASP3-1, ASP3-2, ASP3-3 and ASP3-4 are
CC       arranged in tandem repeats located near a ribosomal DNA cluster.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the asparaginase 1 family. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 asparaginase/glutaminase domain.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU01068}.

CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:342521, ECO:0000269|PubMed:6986375};
CC         Vmax=135 umol/min/mg enzyme for N-glycyl-L-asparagine
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:342521, ECO:0000269|PubMed:6986375};
CC         Vmax=56 umol/min/mg enzyme for N-valyl-L-asparagine
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:342521, ECO:0000269|PubMed:6986375};
CC         Vmax=92 umol/min/mg enzyme for N-methionyl-L-asparagine
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:342521, ECO:0000269|PubMed:6986375};
CC         Vmax=8 umol/min/mg enzyme for N-glycyl-D-asparagine
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:342521, ECO:0000269|PubMed:6986375};
CC         Note=Does not act on isoasparagine, L-aspartate diamide, beta-
CC         alanine amide and L-glutamine.;
CC       pH dependence:
CC         Optimum pH is 6.8. Active from pH 5.5 to pH 7.5. Stable from pH
CC         3.5 to pH 10.5. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:342521,
CC         ECO:0000269|PubMed:6986375};
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted. Periplasm.
CC   -!- INDUCTION: Subject to nitrogen catabolite repression (NCR). Not
CC       found in cells grown on rich nitrogen sources like ammonia,
CC       glutamine or glutamate, but is found in cells that have been
CC       subjected to nitrogen starvation or have been grown on a poor
CC       nitrogen source such as proline. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:6995441}.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: Yeast contains 2 L-asparaginase isoenzymes:
CC       cytoplasmic L-asparaginase I, and cell wall L-asparaginase II.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: There are 4 copies for L-asparaginase 2 in yeast.
CC       The 4 identical copies ASP3-1, ASP3-2, ASP3-3 and ASP3-4 are
CC       arranged in tandem repeats located near a ribosomal DNA cluster.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the asparaginase 1 family. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 asparaginase/glutaminase domain.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU01068}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Hydrolyzes dalpatein 7-O-beta-D-apiofuranosyl-(1->6)-
CC       beta-D-glucopyranoside and dalnigrein 7-O-beta-D-apiofuranosyl-
CC       (1->6)-beta-D-glucopyranoside. Also has activity towards pNP-beta-
CC       D-fucoside and pNP-beta-D-glucoside, but not pNP-beta-
CC       cellobioside. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16098548}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: 7-(beta-D-apiofuranosyl-(1->6)-beta-D-
CC       glucopyranosyloxy)isoflavonoid + H(2)O = a 7-hydroxyisoflavonoid +
CC       beta-D-apiofuranosyl-(1->6)-D-glucose.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16098548}.
CC   -!- ENZYME REGULATION: Not inhibited by iron, calcium, mercury,
CC       manganese, zinc or EDTA. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16098548}.
CC   -!- BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES:
CC       Kinetic parameters:
CC         KM=14.7 mM for pNP-beta-D-glucoside
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16098548};
CC         KM=1.8 mM for pNP-beta-D-fucoside {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16098548};
CC         KM=0.5 mM for dalpatein 7-O-beta-D-apiofuranosyl-(1->6)-beta-D-
CC         glucopyranoside {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16098548};
CC         KM=0.7 mM for dalnigrein 7-O-beta-D-apiofuranosyl-(1->6)-beta-D-
CC         glucopyranoside {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16098548};
CC         KM=0.11 mM for daidzin {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16098548};
CC         KM=0.09 mM for genistin {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16098548};
CC       pH dependence:
CC         Optimum pH is 5.0-6.0. Half maximum activity is seen at pH 3.5
CC         and 6.5. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16098548};
CC       Temperature dependence:
CC         Optimum temperature is 65 degrees Celsius.
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16098548};

RP   INDUCTION.
RX   PubMed=20402792; DOI=10.1111/j.1567-1364.2010.00626.x;
RA   Li X., Du W., Zhao J., Zhang L., Zhu Z., Jiang L.;

RN   [11]
RP   FUNCTION, AND DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE.
RX   PubMed=22876186; DOI=10.1371/journal.ppat.1002848;
RA   Taff H.T., Nett J.E., Zarnowski R., Ross K.M., Sanchez H., Cain M.T.,
RA   Hamaker J., Mitchell A.P., Andes D.R.;
RT   "A Candida biofilm-induced pathway for matrix glucan delivery:
RT   implications for drug resistance.";
RL   PLoS Pathog. 8:E1002848-E1002848(2012).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Cell wall glucan 1,3-beta-glucosidase involved in cell
CC       wall biosynthesis and virulence. Crucial for delivery of beta-1,3-
CC       glucan to the biofilm matrix and for accumulation of mature matrix
CC       biomass. Plays a role as a major antigen in human systemic
CC       candidiasis patients. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:22876186,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:7851411, ECO:0000269|PubMed:9043114}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Successive hydrolysis of beta-D-glucose units
CC       from the non-reducing ends of (1->3)-beta-D-glucans, releasing
CC       alpha-glucose. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:7851411}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted, cell wall
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19013773}. Cytoplasm
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19013773}. Note=Tightly bound to cell wall. A
CC       fraction of unprecessed protein is found in the cytoplasm.
CC   -!- INDUCTION: Induced during biofilm formation and by fluconazole and
CC       micafungin. Expression is also regulated by RCK2.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15820985, ECO:0000269|PubMed:19013773,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:19527170, ECO:0000269|PubMed:20402792}.
CC   -!- DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Exhibits diminished extracellular biofilm
CC       material, renders cells more dependent on chitin for wall
CC       integrity, and attenuates virulence in mice.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:22876186, ECO:0000269|PubMed:9043114}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the glycosyl hydrolase 17 family.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.

ID   CBDAS_CANSA             Reviewed;         544 AA.
AC   A6P6V9;
DT   06-FEB-2013, integrated into UniProtKB/Swiss-Prot.
DT   21-AUG-2007, sequence version 1.
DT   27-MAY-2015, entry version 28.
DE   RecName: Full=Cannabidiolic acid synthase;
DE            EC=1.21.3.8;
DE   AltName: Full=CBDA synthase.;
DE   Flags: Precursor;
GN   Name=CBDAS;
OS   Cannabis sativa (Hemp) (Marijuana).
OC   Eukaryota; Viridiplantae; Streptophyta; Embryophyta; Tracheophyta;
OC   Spermatophyta; Magnoliophyta; eudicotyledons; Gunneridae;
OC   Pentapetalae; rosids; fabids; Rosales; Cannabaceae; Cannabis.
OX   NCBI_TaxID=3483;
RN   [1]
RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [MRNA], PROTEIN SEQUENCE OF 29-53; 395-408 AND
RP   428-442, FUNCTION, CATALYTIC ACTIVITY, GLYCOSYLATION, AND MUTAGENESIS
RP   OF HIS-114.
RX   PubMed=17544411; DOI=10.1016/j.febslet.2007.05.043;
RA   Taura F., Sirikantaramas S., Shoyama Y., Yoshikai K., Shoyama Y.,
RA   Morimoto S.;
RT   "Cannabidiolic-acid synthase, the chemotype-determining enzyme in the
RT   fiber-type Cannabis sativa.";
RL   FEBS Lett. 581:2929-2934(2007).
RN   [2]
RP   PROTEIN SEQUENCE OF 29-44, CATALYTIC ACTIVITY, BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL
RP   PROPERTIES, ENZYME REGULATION, SUBUNIT, SUBSTRATE SPECIFICITY, TISSUE
RP   SPECIFICITY, AND SUBCELLULAR LOCATION.
RX   PubMed=8663284; DOI=10.1074/jbc.271.29.17411;
RA   Taura F., Morimoto S., Shoyama Y.;
RT   "Purification and characterization of cannabidiolic-acid synthase from
RT   Cannabis sativa L. Biochemical analysis of a novel enzyme that
RT   catalyzes the oxidocyclization of cannabigerolic acid to cannabidiolic
RT   acid.";
RL   J. Biol. Chem. 271:17411-17416(1996).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Catalyzes the stereoselective oxidative cyclization of
CC       the monoterpene moiety in cannabigerolic acid (CBGA), producing
CC       cannabidiolate (CBDA), the major cannabioid in fiber-type Cannabis
CC       plants. Can also use cannabinerolic acid as substrate, but not
CC       cannabigerol or cannabinerol. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17544411}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Cannabigerolate + O(2) = cannabidiolate +
CC       H(2)O(2). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17544411,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:8663284}.
CC   -!- ENZYME REGULATION: Inhibited by Hg(2+).
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:8663284}.
CC   -!- BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES:
CC       Kinetic parameters:
CC         KM=0.137 mM for cannabigerolic acid
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:8663284};
CC         KM=0.206 mM for cannabinerolic acid
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:8663284};
CC         Vmax=2.57 nmol/sec/mg enzyme with cannabigerolic acid as
CC         substrate {ECO:0000269|PubMed:8663284};
CC         Vmax=0.39 nmol/sec/mg enzyme with cannabinerolic acid as
CC         substrate {ECO:0000269|PubMed:8663284};
CC       pH dependence:
CC         Optimum pH is 5.0. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:8663284};
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Monomer. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:8663284}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted {ECO:0000269|PubMed:8663284}.
CC       Secreted, extracellular space, apoplast {ECO:0000250}.
CC       Note=Probably sorted from the secretory cells into the storage
CC       cavity of glandular trichomes.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed in young leaves.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:8663284}.
CC   -!- PTM: Glycosylated. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17544411}.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: CBDA synthase might contribute to the self-defense
CC       of Cannabis plants by producing both CBDA and hydrogen peroxide,
CC       but since these reaction products are toxic to the plant itself,
CC       CBDA synthase is probably secreted from secretory cells into the
CC       storage cavity to avoid cellular damage. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the oxygen-dependent FAD-linked
CC       oxidoreductase family. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 FAD-binding PCMH-type domain.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00718}.

CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License

RP   PROTEIN SEQUENCE OF 24-40, SUBUNIT, CATALYTIC ACTIVITY, SUBSTRATE
RP   SPECIFICITY, BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES, ENZYME REGULATION, AND

RX   PubMed=7724669; DOI=10.1104/pp.107.2.331;
RA   Dharmawardhana D.P., Ellis B.E., Carlson J.E.;
RT   "A beta-glucosidase from lodgepole pine xylem specific for the lignin
RT   precursor coniferin.";
RL   Plant Physiol. 107:331-339(1995).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Involved in the release of monolignols for lignin
CC       biosynthesis. Unable to hydrolyze 4-nitrophenyl beta-cellobioside
CC       or alpha-linked methylumbelliferyl glucoside.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Coniferin + H(2)O = D-glucose + coniferol.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10412914, ECO:0000269|PubMed:7724669}.
CC   -!- ENZYME REGULATION: Inhibited by glucono-1,5-lactone, but not by
CC       bromoconduritol or conduritol B epoxide.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:7724669}.
CC   -!- BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES:
CC       Kinetic parameters:
CC         KM=0.18 mM for coniferin {ECO:0000269|PubMed:7724669};
CC         KM=0.29 mM for syringin {ECO:0000269|PubMed:7724669};
CC         KM=2.3 mM for 4-methylumbelliferyl p-glucoside
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:7724669};
CC         KM=1.9 mM for 4-nitrophenyl P-glucoside
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:7724669};
CC       pH dependence:
CC         Optimum pH is 5.4-5.9. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:7724669};
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homodimer. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:7724669}.
CC   -!- PTM: Glycosylated. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:7724669}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the glycosyl hydrolase 1 family.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.

RN   [3] {ECO:0000305}
RP   X-RAY CRYSTALLOGRAPHY (2.4 ANGSTROMS) OF 24-812 IN COMPLEX WITH
RP   HEPTAXYLOGLUCAN.
RX   PubMed=17498741; DOI=10.1016/j.jmb.2007.04.035;
RA   Yaoi K., Kondo H., Hiyoshi A., Noro N., Sugimoto H., Tsuda S.,
RA   Mitsuishi Y., Miyazaki K.;
RT   "The structural basis for the exo-mode of action in GH74
RT   oligoxyloglucan reducing end-specific cellobiohydrolase.";
RL   J. Mol. Biol. 370:53-62(2007).
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Hydrolysis of cellobiose from the reducing end
CC       of xyloglucans consisting of a beta-(1->4)-linked glucan carrying
CC       alpha-D-xylosyl groups on O-6 of the glucose residues. To be a
CC       substrate, the first residue must be unsubstituted, the second
CC       residue may bear a xylosyl group, whether further glycosylated or
CC       not, and the third residue, which becomes the new terminus by the
CC       action of the enzyme, is preferably xylosylated, but this xylose
CC       residue must not be further substituted.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12374797}.
CC   -!- BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES:
CC       pH dependence:
CC         Optimum pH is 3.5-5.0 with the oligoxyloglucan heptasaccharide
CC         XXXG as a substrate. Over 90% activity is retained between pH
CC         4.8 and 8.0. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12374797};
CC       Temperature dependence:
CC         Optimum temperature is 50-60 degrees Celsius with the
CC         oligoxyloglucan heptasaccharide XXXG as a substrate.
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12374797};
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the glycosyl hydrolase 74 family.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12374797}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 7 BNR repeats. {ECO:0000255}.

RA   Muta T., Oda T., Iwanaga S.;
RT   "Horseshoe crab coagulation factor B. A unique serine protease zymogen
RT   activated by cleavage of an Ile-Ile bond.";

RN   [2] {ECO:0000305}
RP   FUNCTION, ENZYME REGULATION, BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES, AND
RP   SUBUNIT.
RX   PubMed=3519594;
RA   Nakamura T., Horiuchi T., Morita T., Iwanaga S.;
RT   "Purification and properties of intracellular clotting factor, factor
RT   B, from horseshoe crab (Tachypleus tridentatus) hemocytes.";
RL   J. Biochem. 99:847-857(1986).
RN   [3] {ECO:0000305}
RP   FUNCTION, AND CATALYTIC ACTIVITY.
RX   PubMed=2266134;
RA   Muta T., Hashimoto R., Miyata T., Nishimura H., Toh Y., Iwanaga S.;
RT   "Proclotting enzyme from horseshoe crab hemocytes. cDNA cloning,
RT   disulfide locations, and subcellular localization.";
RL   J. Biol. Chem. 265:22426-22433(1990).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: This enzyme is closely associated with an endotoxin-
CC       sensitive hemolymph coagulation system which may play important
CC       roles in both hemostasis and host defense mechanisms. Its active
CC       form catalyzes the activation of proclotting enzyme. Does not
CC       activate the mammalian coagulation factors factor IX, factor X,
CC       prothrombin, plasminogen, protein C or prekallikrein. Does not
CC       hydrolyze fibrinogen. Does not catalyze the activation of factor C
CC       or coagulogen. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:2266134,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:3519594}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Selective cleavage of 98-Arg-|-Ile-99 bond in
CC       Limulus proclotting enzyme to form active clotting enzyme.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:2266134}.
CC   -!- ENZYME REGULATION: Strongly inhibited by alpha2-plasmin inhibitor
CC       and DFP. Partially inhibited by benzamidine, leupeptin and PCMB.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:3519594}.
CC   -!- BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES:
CC       Kinetic parameters:
CC         Vmax=0.9 umol/min/mg enzyme toward Boc-Val-Pro-Arg-MCA
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:3519594};

RP   PROTEOLYSIS, DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE, AND TISSUE SPECIFICITY.
RX   PubMed=17562289;
RA   Li Q., Wang B.-C., Xu Y., Zhu Y.-X.;
RT   "Systematic studies of 12S seed storage protein accumulation and
RT   degradation patterns during Arabidopsis seed maturation and early
RT   seedling germination stages.";
RL   J. Biochem. Mol. Biol. 40:373-381(2007).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Seed storage protein.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Hexamer; each subunit is composed of an acidic and a
CC       basic chain derived from a single precursor and linked by a
CC       disulfide bond.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Protein storage vacuole {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Accumulates in seeds 8 days after anthesis.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12417707, ECO:0000269|PubMed:17562289}.
CC   -!- DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE: First observed in siliques 15 days post
CC       anthesis and accumulates progressively as native isoforms or
CC       proteolytic fragments during the last week of seed
CC       maturation/desiccation. Present in dry seeds, but disappears
CC       during their germination (at protein level).
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17562289}.
CC   -!- PTM: Ubiquitinated. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: Proteolytically processed during seed maturation at a
CC       conserved Asn-Gly peptide bond by an asparaginyl endopeptidase to
CC       produce two mature polypeptides referred to as alpha and beta
CC       subunits that are joined together by a disulfide bond.
CC   -!- PTM: Phosphorylated in seeds on some Tyr residues in response to
CC       abscisic acid (ABA). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the 11S seed storage protein (globulins)
CC       family. {ECO:0000305}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Seed storage protein.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Hexamer; each subunit is composed of an acidic and a
CC       basic chain derived from a single precursor and linked by a
CC       disulfide bond. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Protein storage vacuole {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=4;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=Q96318-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=Q96318-2; Sequence=VSP_039933, VSP_039934;
CC         Note=Ref.7 (BAH56848) sequence is in conflict in position:
CC         204:G->V. No experimental confirmation available. {ECO:0000305};
CC       Name=3;
CC         IsoId=Q96318-3; Sequence=VSP_039936, VSP_039938;
CC         Note=Derived from EST data. No experimental confirmation
CC         available.;
CC       Name=4;
CC         IsoId=Q96318-4; Sequence=VSP_039935, VSP_039937;
CC         Note=Derived from EST data. No experimental confirmation
CC         available.;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Accumulates in seeds 8 days after anthesis.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12417707, ECO:0000269|PubMed:17562289}.
CC   -!- DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE: Detected in siliques at nucleotide level from
CC       6 days post anthesis (dpa) to 17 dpa. First observed in siliques
CC       at protein level 12 dpa and accumulates progressively as native
CC       isoforms or proteolytic fragments during the last week of seed
CC       maturation/desiccation. Present in dry seeds, but disappears
CC       during their germination (at protein level).
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17562289, ECO:0000269|PubMed:7827492,
CC       ECO:0000269|Ref.10}.
CC   -!- INDUCTION: By abscisic acid (ABA) in an ABI3- and FUS3-dependent
CC       manner. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15695463, ECO:0000269|PubMed:7827492}.
CC   -!- PTM: Ubiquitinated. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19292762}.
CC   -!- PTM: Proteolytically processed during seed maturation at a
CC       conserved Asn-Gly peptide bond by an asparaginyl endopeptidase to
CC       produce two mature polypeptides referred to as alpha and beta
CC       subunits that are joined together by a disulfide bond.
CC   -!- PTM: Phosphorylated in seeds on some Tyr residues in response to
CC       abscisic acid (ABA). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17313365,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:18768909}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the 11S seed storage protein (globulins)
CC       family. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SEQUENCE CAUTION:
CC       Sequence=BAD95275.1; Type=Erroneous initiation; Note=Translation N-terminally extended.; Evidence={ECO:0000305};
CC       Sequence=BAH56848.1; Type=Erroneous initiation; Note=Translation N-terminally extended.; Evidence={ECO:0000305};

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Produced only during pregnancy and is involved in
CC       stimulating lactation, fetal growth and metabolism. Does not
CC       interact with GHR but only activates PRLR through zinc-induced
CC       dimerization. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16546209}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Can be found in a monomeric as well as dimeric form.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:438159}.

CC       aa.

RP   FUNCTION, CATALYTIC ACTIVITY, AND MUTAGENESIS OF ASP-160 AND GLU-169.
RC   STRAIN=Y2K;
RX   PubMed=16330537; DOI=10.1074/jbc.M512506200;
RA   Cheng C.Y., Chang C.H., Wu Y.J., Li Y.K.;

RT   Aspergillus fumigatus.";
RL   J. Biol. Chem. 281:3137-3144(2006).
RN   [6]
RP   FUNCTION, CATALYTIC ACTIVITY, AND BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES.
RC   STRAIN=Y2K;
RX   PubMed=22160328; DOI=10.1007/s10529-011-0816-0;
RA   Chen X., Zhai C., Kang L., Li C., Yan H., Zhou Y., Yu X., Ma L.;
RT   "High-level expression and characterization of a highly thermostable
RT   chitosanase from Aspergillus fumigatus in Pichia pastoris.";
RL   Biotechnol. Lett. 34:689-694(2012).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Chitosanase catalyzing the endo-type cleavage of
CC       chitosan, the deacylated form of chitin. Chitosanase may be
CC       crucial in the degradation of the deacetylated portion of chitin
CC       in the fungal cell wall. Chitoolisaccharides produced by the
CC       hydrolysis of partially N-acetylated chitosan are known to have
CC       many biological activities, including antibacterial activity,
CC       immune-enhancing effects, and ellicitor activity. The chitosans
CC       with higher degrees of deacetylation were shown to be the better
CC       substrates. Chitodimer, chitotrimer, and chitotetramer are the
CC       major products but monoacetyl chitodimer, monoacetyl chitotrimer,
CC       and monoacetyl chitotetramer are also produced.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16330537, ECO:0000269|PubMed:17651155,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:22160328}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Endohydrolysis of beta-(1->4)-linkages between
CC       D-glucosamine residues in a partly acetylated chitosan.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11115392, ECO:0000269|PubMed:16330537,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:22160328}.
CC   -!- BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES:
CC       pH dependence:
CC         Optimum pH is 6.5. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11115392,
CC         ECO:0000269|PubMed:22160328};
CC       Temperature dependence:
CC         Optimum temperature is between 65 and 70 degrees Celsius.
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11115392, ECO:0000269|PubMed:22160328};
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16396247,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:17651155}.
CC   -!- INDUCTION: Expressed during human infection.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16396247}.
CC   -!- ALLERGEN: Causes an allergic reaction in human. Binds to IgE.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the glycosyl hydrolase 75 family.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Specific inhibitor of papain family cysteine
CC       proteinases. Inhibits papain, chymopapain, bromelain, ficin, human
CC       cathepsins B, H and L, actinidain and house dustmite endopeptidase
CC       1, but does not inhibit human bleomycin hydrolase. Inhibits papain
CC       with an IC(50) of 2.47 nM. Does not inhibit cysteine proteinases
CC       belonging to other families including clostripain, streptopain and
CC       calpain. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:14697268,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:19885843}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:P01035}.
CC   -!- PTM: Glycosylated. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19885843}.

CC       Evidence={ECO:0000269|PubMed:14697268};

CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:19885843};
CC   -!- MASS SPECTROMETRY: Mass=11055.2; Method=MALDI; Range=27-116;
CC       Evidence={ECO:0000269|PubMed:14697268,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:19885843};

RP   FUNCTION, TISSUE SPECIFICITY, DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE, AND GENE FAMILY.
RC   STRAIN=cv. Columbia;
RX   PubMed=22854967; DOI=10.1074/jbc.M112.387423;
RA   Kim K.-W., Moinuddin S.G.A., Atwell K.M., Costa M.A., Davin L.B.,
RA   Lewis N.G.;
RT   "Opposite stereoselectivities of dirigent proteins in Arabidopsis and
RT   schizandra species.";
RL   J. Biol. Chem. 287:33957-33972(2012).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Dirigent proteins impart stereoselectivity on the
CC       phenoxy radical-coupling reaction, yielding optically active
CC       lignans from two molecules of coniferyl alcohol in the
CC       biosynthesis of lignans, flavonolignans, and alkaloids and thus
CC       plays a central role in plant secondary metabolism.
CC       Enantiocomplementary dirigent protein that mediates the laccase-
CC       catalyzed enantioselective oxidative phenol coupling of (E)-
CC       coniferyl alcohol to (-)-pinoresinol.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19946920, ECO:0000269|PubMed:22854967}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homodimer. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:22443713}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       Self; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-7796038, EBI-7796038;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted, extracellular space, apoplast
CC       {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed in roots, cotyledon veins, leaf
CC       trichomes, flowers, siliques, and meristems. Present in
CC       interfascicular/vascular cambia and developing xylem.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:22854967}.
CC   -!- DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE: In flowers, expressed in the vasculature of
CC       petals, stamen filaments, anther microsporangia, and papillar
CC       cells of the stigma and style. In siliques, accumulates in the
CC       stigmatic region, replum, funiculus, and valve.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:22854967}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the plant dirigent protein family.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.

RN   [1] {ECO:0000305, ECO:0000312|EMBL:BAL41365.1}
RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [MRNA], PROTEIN SEQUENCE OF 20-37, FUNCTION,
RP   SUBCELLULAR LOCATION, TISSUE SPECIFICITY, DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE, AND
RP   CALCIUM-BINDING.
RC   TISSUE=Saliva {ECO:0000269|PubMed:22019571}, and
RC   Salivary gland {ECO:0000269|PubMed:22019571};
RX   PubMed=22019571; DOI=10.1016/j.ibmb.2011.10.001;
RA   Hattori M., Nakamura M., Komatsu S., Tsuchihara K., Tamura Y.,
RA   Hasegawa T.;
RT   "Molecular cloning of a novel calcium-binding protein in the secreted
RT   saliva of the green rice leafhopper Nephotettix cincticeps.";
RL   Insect Biochem. Mol. Biol. 42:1-9(2012).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Binds calcium. During feeding of the phloem sap, protein
CC       is injected into sieve tubes of rice plants. This process may
CC       suppress the sieve-element clogging and facilitate continuous
CC       ingestion from sieve tubes. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:22019571,
CC       ECO:0000303|PubMed:22019571}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted {ECO:0000269|PubMed:22019571}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed in salivary glands where expression
CC       is strongest in type III cells in the posterior lobe of the
CC       principal glands (at protein level). Not expressed in midgut,
CC       Malpighian tubules or epidermis. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:22019571}.

RP   PROTEIN SEQUENCE OF 23-51; 60-109; 113-129; 134-206; 212-222; 228-251;
RP   255-262; 271-289; 292-301; 315-363; 367-377 AND 387-417, FUNCTION,
RP   HOMODIMERIZATION, DISULFIDE BONDS, BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES,
RP   SIGNAL SEQUENCE CLEAVAGE SITE, GLYCOSYLATION AT ASN-100; ASN-118;
RP   ASN-341 AND ASN-406, AND GPI-ANCHOR.
RC   TISSUE=Brain;
RX   PubMed=23161088; DOI=10.1007/s11064-012-0921-z;
RA   Greiner-Tollersrud L., Berg T., Stensland H.M., Evjen G.,
RA   Greiner-Tollersrud O.K.;
RT   "Bovine brain myelin glycerophosphocholine choline phosphodiesterase
RT   is an alkaline lysosphingomyelinase of the eNPP-family, regulated by
RT   lysosomal sorting.";
RL   Neurochem. Res. 38:300-310(2013).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Choline-specific glycerophosphodiester
CC       phosphodiesterase. The preferred substrate may be
CC       lysosphingomyelin. Also hydrolyzes lysophosphatidylcholine (LPC)
CC       to form monoacylglycerol and phosphorylcholine but not
CC       lysophosphatidic acid, showing it has a lysophospholipase C
CC       activity. Has a preference for LPC with short (12:0 and 14:0) or
CC       polyunsaturated (18:2 and 20:4) fatty acids. Also hydrolyzes
CC       glycerophosphorylcholine and sphingosylphosphorylcholine
CC       efficiently. Hydrolyzes the classical substrate for phospholipase
CC       C, p-nitrophenyl phosphorylcholine in vitro, while it does not
CC       hydrolyze the classical nucleotide phosphodiesterase substrate, p-
CC       nitrophenyl thymidine 5'-monophosphate. Does not hydrolyze diacyl
CC       phospholipids such as phosphatidylethanolamine,
CC       phosphatidylinositol, phosphatidylserine, phosphatidylglycerol and
CC       phosphatidic acid (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: A lysophosphatidylcholine + H(2)O = a
CC       monoacylglycerol + phosphocholine.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: sn-glycero-3-phosphocholine + H(2)O = glycerol
CC       + phosphocholine.
CC   -!- COFACTOR:
CC       Name=a divalent metal cation; Xref=ChEBI:CHEBI:60240;
CC         Evidence={ECO:0000250};
CC   -!- ENZYME REGULATION: Inhibited by EDTA and EGTA in vitro.
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES:
CC       Kinetic parameters:
CC         KM=2000 uM for lysophosphatidylcholine
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:23161088};
CC         KM=5000 uM for glycerophosphocholine
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:23161088};
CC         KM=35 uM for p-nitrophenylphosphocholine
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:23161088};
CC         KM=5 uM for lysosphingomyelin {ECO:0000269|PubMed:23161088};
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homodimer; disulfide-linked.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:23161088}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell membrane; Lipid-anchor, GPI-anchor.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the nucleotide
CC       pyrophosphatase/phosphodiesterase family. {ECO:0000305}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Carboxylesterase that catalyzes the hydrolysis of
CC       pyrethroids pesticides. Hydrolyzes trans-permethrin at a rate
CC       about 22-fold higher than cis-permethrin. Also hydrolyzes trans-
CC       cypermethrin. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15123619}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Trans-permethrin + H(2)O = (3-
CC       phenoxyphenyl)methanol + (1S,3R)-3-(2,2-dichloroethenyl)-2,2-
CC       dimethylcyclopropanecarboxylate. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15123619}.
CC   -!- BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES:
CC       Kinetic parameters:
CC         KM=286 uM for p-Nitrophenyl acetate
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15123619};
CC         KM=0.5 uM for cypermethrin {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15123619};
CC         KM=2.2 uM for (R/S)-alpha-cyano(6-methoxy-2-naphthyl)-methyl-
CC         (R/S)-trans/cis-3-(2,2-dichlorovinyl)-2,2-dimethylcyclopropane
CC         carboxylate {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15123619};
CC         KM=0.89 uM for (R/S)-alpha-cyano(6-methoxy-2-naphthyl)-methyl-
CC         (R)-(-)-2-(4-chlorophenyl)-3-methyl butanoate ((alphaR/S)(2R)-
CC         A3) {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15123619};
CC         KM=0.96 uM for chrysanthemic acid {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15123619};
CC         Note=kcat is 94 sec(-1) with p-Nitrophenyl acetate as substrate.
CC         kcat is 0.12 sec(-1) with cypermethrin as substrate. kcat is
CC         0.11 sec(-1) with (R/S)-alpha-cyano(6-methoxy-2-naphthyl)-

RN   [6]
RP   PHARMACEUTICAL.
RX   PubMed=21184772; DOI=10.1016/j.toxicon.2010.12.010;
RA   Earl S.T., Masci P.P., de Jersey J., Lavin M.F., Dixon J.;
RT   "Drug development from Australian elapid snake venoms and the Venomics
RT   pipeline of candidates for haemostasis: Textilinin-1 (Q8008),
RT   Haempatch (Q8009) and CoVase (V0801).";
RL   Toxicon 59:456-463(2012).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Snake prothrombin activator that attacks the hemostatic
CC       system of prey. This non-catalytic subunit is functionally similar
CC       to blood coagulation factor V. It serves as a critical cofactor
CC       for the prothrombinase activity of the catalytic subunit, which is
CC       similar to the blood coagulation factor X.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12362232}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Heterodimer of a light and a heavy chains; non-disulfide-
CC       linked. The interaction between the two chains is calcium-
CC       dependent (By similarity). Found in its active form associated
CC       with pseutarin-C catalytic subunit (AC Q56VR3). {ECO:0000250,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:12362232}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12362232,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:12730119}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed by the venom gland.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12362232, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12730119,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:15735790}.
CC   -!- PTM: In physiological conditions, blood coagulation factor V and
CC       factor Va are inactivated by activated protein C (APC) through
CC       proteolytic degradation of the heavy chain. However, pseutarin-C
CC       non-catalytic subunit (factor V-like protein) retains its full
CC       activity even at high concentration of APC. This has two
CC       explanations: this protein has only one of the three cleavage
CC       sites present in factor V that are targeted by the APC for
CC       inactivation, and the binding with the catalytic subunit protect
CC       the cleavage site from inactivation.
CC   -!- PHARMACEUTICAL: Is under preclinical trial by the Australian
CC       biopharmaceutical company QRxPharma Ltd, its subsidiary Venomics
CC       Pty Ltd (VPL) and the University of Queensland (UQ) under the name
CC       CoVase (V0801). Tested as a procoagulant cofactor that may have
CC       application as a systemic anti-bleeding agent in the treatment of
CC       internal bleeding and non-compressible haemorrhage.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: In contrast to blood coagulation factors that
CC       circulate as inactive zymogen in plasma, venom prothrombin
CC       activators are always found in the active form in the venom.
CC       Hence, catalytic and non-catalytic subunits are found naturally in
CC       venom as stable complexes.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the multicopper oxidase family.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 3 F5/8 type A domains. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 2 F5/8 type C domains. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00081}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 6 plastocyanin-like domains. {ECO:0000305}.

CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License

RC   TISSUE=Foot {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19584055};
RX   PubMed=19584055; DOI=10.1074/jbc.M109.022517;
RA   Zhao H., Sagert J., Hwang D.S., Waite J.H.;
RT   "Glycosylated hydroxytryptophan in a mussel adhesive protein from
RT   Perna viridis.";
RL   J. Biol. Chem. 284:23344-23352(2009).
RN   [2] {ECO:0000305}
RP   PROTEIN SEQUENCE OF REPEAT A, PROTEIN SEQUENCE OF REPEAT B, TISSUE
RP   SPECIFICITY, HYDROXYLATION, GLYCOSYLATION, AND IDENTIFICATION BY MASS
RP   SPECTROMETRY.
RC   TISSUE=Foot {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15203964};
RX   PubMed=15203964; DOI=10.1080/08927010410001681246;
RA   Ohkawa K., Nishida A., Yamamoto H., Waite J.H.;
RT   "A glycosylated byssal precursor protein from the green mussel Perna
RT   viridis with modified dopa side-chains.";
RL   Biofouling 20:101-115(2004).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Provides adhesiveness to the mussel's foot. Mussels
CC       produce one of the strongest water insoluble glues. The mussel's
CC       adhesive is a bundle of threads, called a byssus, formed by a
CC       fibrous collagenous core coated with adhesive proteins (By
CC       similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q25460}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Produced by the byssal gland.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15203964, ECO:0000269|PubMed:19584055}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: Almost exclusively composed of repeats of the decapeptides
CC       APPPAWTAWK and ATPKPWTAWK. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19584055}.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: The identity of the hexosyl group at the C-2
CC       position in the modified tryptophan residues has not been
CC       confirmed, but UV absorbance data suggests that it is mannose.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19584055, ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: On the 2D-gel the molecular weight of this protein
CC       is: 89 kDa. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15203964}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 collagen-like domain. {ECO:0000255}.
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------
CC   Copyrighted by the UniProt Consortium, see http://www.uniprot.org/terms
CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------

DT   01-OCT-2014, entry version 19.
DE   RecName: Full=Foot protein 1 variant 2 {ECO:0000303|PubMed:19584055, ECO:0000312|EMBL:AAY46227.1};
DE   Flags: Precursor;
GN   Name=fp-1 {ECO:0000312|EMBL:AAY46227.1};
OS   Perna viridis (Tropical green mussel).
OC   Eukaryota; Metazoa; Lophotrochozoa; Mollusca; Bivalvia; Pteriomorphia;
OC   Mytiloida; Mytiloidea; Mytilidae; Mytilinae; Perna.
OX   NCBI_TaxID=73031;
RN   [1] {ECO:0000305, ECO:0000312|EMBL:AAY46227.1}
RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [MRNA], PROTEIN SEQUENCE OF 21-34, PROTEIN
RP   SEQUENCE OF REPEAT A, PROTEIN SEQUENCE OF REPEAT B, TISSUE
RP   SPECIFICITY, HYDROXYLATION, GLYCOSYLATION, AND IDENTIFICATION BY MASS
RP   SPECTROMETRY.
RC   TISSUE=Foot {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19584055};
RX   PubMed=19584055; DOI=10.1074/jbc.M109.022517;
RA   Zhao H., Sagert J., Hwang D.S., Waite J.H.;
RT   "Glycosylated hydroxytryptophan in a mussel adhesive protein from
RT   Perna viridis.";
RL   J. Biol. Chem. 284:23344-23352(2009).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Provides adhesiveness to the mussel's foot. Mussels
CC       produce one of the strongest water insoluble glues. The mussel's
CC       adhesive is a bundle of threads, called a byssus, formed by a
CC       fibrous collagenous core coated with adhesive proteins (By
CC       similarity). {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q25460}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q25460}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Produced by the byssal gland.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19584055}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: Almost exclusively composed of repeats of the decapeptides
CC       APPPAWTAWK and ATPKPWTAWK. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19584055}.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: The identity of the hexosyl group at the C-2
CC       position in the modified tryptophan residues has not been
CC       confirmed, but UV absorbance data suggests that it is mannose.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19584055, ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 collagen-like domain. {ECO:0000255}.

CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------

RT   "The stacking tryptophan of galactose oxidase: a second-coordination
RT   sphere residue that has profound effects on tyrosyl radical behavior
RT   and enzyme catalysis.";
RL   Biochemistry 46:4606-4618(2007).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Catalyzes the sterospecific oxidation of primary
CC       alcohols to the corresponding aldehydes. The biologically relevant
CC       substrate of the enzyme is not known as the enzyme exhibits broad
CC       substrate specificity from small alcohols through sugars to oligo-
CC       and polysaccharides. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:13641238,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:4441089}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: D-galactose + O(2) = D-galacto-hexodialdose +
CC       H(2)O(2).
CC   -!- COFACTOR:
CC       Name=Cu(2+); Xref=ChEBI:CHEBI:29036;
CC       Note=Binds 1 Cu(2+) ion per subunit.;
CC   -!- ENZYME REGULATION: Inhibited by diethyldithiocarbamate.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:14012475}.
CC   -!- BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES:
CC       Kinetic parameters:
CC         KM=56 mM for 1-methyl-alpha-D-galactopyranoside
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15047910, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15239055,
CC         ECO:0000269|PubMed:17385891, ECO:0000269|PubMed:7929198,
CC         ECO:0000269|Ref.15};
CC         KM=57 mM for 2-methylene-1,3-propanediol
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15047910, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15239055,
CC         ECO:0000269|PubMed:17385891, ECO:0000269|PubMed:7929198,
CC         ECO:0000269|Ref.15};
CC         KM=68 mM for D-galactose {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15047910,
CC         ECO:0000269|PubMed:15239055, ECO:0000269|PubMed:17385891,
CC         ECO:0000269|PubMed:7929198, ECO:0000269|Ref.15};
CC         KM=2.5 M for D-fructose {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15047910,
CC         ECO:0000269|PubMed:15239055, ECO:0000269|PubMed:17385891,
CC         ECO:0000269|PubMed:7929198, ECO:0000269|Ref.15};
CC       pH dependence:
CC         Optimum pH is 7. Active from pH 5.7 to 9.4.
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15047910, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15239055,
CC         ECO:0000269|PubMed:17385891, ECO:0000269|PubMed:7929198,
CC         ECO:0000269|Ref.15};
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Monomer. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15047910,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:17385891, ECO:0000269|PubMed:2002850,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:4441089, ECO:0000269|PubMed:7929198,
CC       ECO:0000269|Ref.15}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted.
CC   -!- PTM: Galactose oxidase contains a protein-derived free radical
CC       cofactor. In the active state, Tyr-313, which is cross-linked to
CC       Cys-269 via a thioether bond, is oxidized to a radical and acts
CC       with Cu(2+) as a two-electron acceptor in the oxidation reaction.
CC       The cross-link is believed to modulate the redox potential of the
CC       tyrosyl radical, which is further stabilized by a stacking
CC       interaction with Trp-331 in the active site. The post-
CC       translational formation of the cross-link is closely linked to the
CC       propeptide cleavage event, and both are copper-dependent,
CC       autocatalytic processes. The propeptide may act as an
CC       intramolecular chaperone, facilitating thioester bond formation
CC       and copper binding by positioning of active-site residues,
CC       including copper ligands.
CC   -!- MASS SPECTROMETRY: Mass=68520; Method=Electrospray; Range=42-680;
CC       Evidence={ECO:0000269|PubMed:15047910};
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 F5/8 type C domain. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00081}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 5 Kelch repeats. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- CAUTION: Was originally thought to originate from Polyporus
CC       circinatus then later from Dactylium dendroides and is now known
CC       to be originating from Gibberella (Fusarium). {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- WEB RESOURCE: Name=Worthington enzyme manual;
CC       URL="http://www.worthington-biochem.com/GAO/";

CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Has antibacterial activity against B.subtilis (MIC=5
CC       ug), B.cereus (MIC=50 ug), A.hydrophila (MIC=2.5 ug),
CC       S.marcescens(MIC=10 ug), S.enterica (MIC=10 ug), P.entomophila
CC       (MIC=2.5 ug) and P.rhodesiae (MIC=10 ug). Has antifungal activity
CC       against F.solani KACC 40384 and F.oxysporum KACC 40032. Probably
CC       has no oxalate oxidase activity even if the active site is
CC       conserved. {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:P94072,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:23284650}.

CC         Celsius. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:23284650};

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Antimicrobial peptide. Has strong antibacterial activity
CC       against the Gram-positive bacterium C.glutamicum (MIC=0.4 uM) and
CC       the Gram-negative bacterium E.coli (MIC=12.5 uM). Has weak
CC       antibacterial activity against the Gram-positive bacterium
CC       S.aureus (MIC>50 uM) and the Gram-negative bacterium P.aeruginosa
CC       (MIC>50 uM). Has antifungal activity against S.cerevisiae
CC       (MIC=12.5) and C.albicans (MIC=6.3 uM). Has weak antifungal
CC       activity against the mold B.cinerea. Presents chitin-binding
CC       activity. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19487032}.

CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:P81058}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Strongly expressed in hemocytes, with weaker
CC       expression in gills and epidermis. Expressed at low levels in
CC       hepatopancreas. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19487032}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Exo-inulinase involved in utilization of the plant
CC       storage polymer inulin, consisting of fructooligosaccharides with
CC       a degree of polymerization (DP) value from 2 to 60. Splits off
CC       terminal fructose units successively from the non-reducing end of
CC       the inulin molecule, and also hydrolyzes levan, stachyose and
CC       raffinose. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11829749}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Hydrolysis of terminal, non-reducing (2->1)-
CC       and (2->6)-linked beta-D-fructofuranose residues in fructans.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11829749}.
CC   -!- BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES:
CC       Kinetic parameters:
CC         KM=0.003 mM for inulin {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11829749};
CC         KM=10.1 mM for stachyose {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11829749};
CC         KM=8 mM for raffinose {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11829749};
CC         Vmax=175 umol/min/mg enzyme toward inulin
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11829749};
CC         Vmax=1.2 umol/min/mg enzyme toward levan
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11829749};
CC         Vmax=80 umol/min/mg enzyme toward stachyose
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11829749};
CC         Vmax=120 umol/min/mg enzyme toward raffinose
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11829749};
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- INDUCTION: Expression is induced in presence of maltose, sucrose
CC       or inulin and controlled by the catabolite repressor creA and by
CC       the inulinolytic genes regulator inuR.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the glycosyl hydrolase 32 family.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.

RN   [1]
RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [MRNA], PROTEIN SEQUENCE OF 25-43, FUNCTION, MASS
RP   SPECTROMETRY, AMIDATION AT VAL-61, 3D-STRUCTURE MODELING IN
RP   INTERACTION WITH KV1.1/KCNA1 AND KV1.2/KCNA2, SITES ARG-28; ARG-33;

RA   Luna-Ramirez K., Bartok A., Restano-Cassulini R.,
RA   Quintero-Hernandez V., Coronas F.I.V., Christensen J., Wright C.E.,
RA   Panyi G., Possani L.D.;
RT   "Structure, molecular modeling, and function of the novel potassium
RT   channel blocker urotoxin isolated from the venom of the Australian
RT   scorpion Urodacus yaschenkoi.";
RL   Mol. Pharmacol. 86:28-41(2014).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Blocker of voltage-gated potassium channels. Has highest
CC       activity on human voltage-gated potassium channel Kv1.2/KCNA2
CC       channels, with an IC(50) of 160 pM, whereas its affinity for other
CC       channels tested was in the nanomolar range (hKv1.1/KCNA1,
CC       IC(50)=253 nM; hKv1.3/KCNA3, IC(50)=91 nM; and hKCa3.1/KCNN4,
CC       IC(50)=70 nM). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:24723491}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed by the venom gland.
CC   -!- MASS SPECTROMETRY: Mass=4012.75; Method=Electrospray; Range=25-61;
CC       Evidence={ECO:0000269|PubMed:24723491};
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: Does not show effect on hKv1.4/KCNA4, hKv1.5/KCNA5,
CC       ether-a-go-go-related gene type 1 (hERG1), and ether-a-go-go-like
CC       (hELK2) channels. {ECO:0000305|PubMed:24723491}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the short scorpion toxin superfamily.
CC       Potassium channel inhibitor family. Alpha-KTx 6 subfamily.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Alpha-methyl-D-mannoside-specific lectin. Has
CC       hemagglutinating activity towards rabbit erythrocytes. Binds to
CC       cytokinins and significantly inhibits physiological effects of
CC       cytokinin activity such as cotyledon expansion and delayed leaf
CC       senescence. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16941222,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:7873922}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homodimer. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16941222}.
CC   -!- PTM: Glycosylated. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:7873922,
CC       ECO:0000303|PubMed:16941222}.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: The hemagglutination activity of native and
CC       recombinant SL-I was not inhibited by cellobiose even at 120 mM,
CC       however alpha-methylmannoside and 2-alpha-mannose inhibited
CC       hemagglutination at 0.38 mM and 0.39 mM respectively.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16941222}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the leguminous lectin family.
CC       {ECO:0000255}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Mannose-specific lectin. Shows agglutinating activity
CC       towards chicken erythrocytes. Has antifungal activity against
CC       A.alternata and Collectotrichum species.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:18776994, ECO:0000269|PubMed:19495769}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homotetramer. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:18776994}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:P30617}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed in the pseudobulb, with highest
CC       levels of expression in the non-swollen internode (at protein
CC       level). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:18776994,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:19495769}.
CC   -!- DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE: Detected at low levels in very young and
CC       young stages, before increasing to high levels during the nearly
CC       mature and mature stages. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19495769}.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: Mannose-binding activity stable when incubated at
CC       85 degrees Celsius for 10 minutes, and increases 3 to 4 fold when
CC       incubated at 85 degrees Celsius for 10 minutes in the presence of
CC       0.14 M 2-mercaptoethanol. Mannose-binding activity decreases to
CC       27% when incubated at 85 degrees Celsius for 10 minutes in the
CC       presence of 0.35 M iodoacetate. Antifungal and hemagglutinating
CC       activity stable when incubated at 100 degrees Celsius for 5
CC       minutes. Antifungal and hemagglutinating activity increase when
CC       incubated at 100 degrees Celsius for 5 minutes in the presence of
CC       0.14 M 2-mercaptoethanol. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:18776994}.

CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00038}.

RA   Duruksu G., Ozturk B., Biely P., Bakir U., Ogel Z.B.;
RT   "Cloning, expression and characterization of endo-beta-1,4-mannanase
RT   from Aspergillus fumigatus in Aspergillus sojae and Pichia pastoris.";
RL   Biotechnol. Prog. 25:271-276(2009).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Endo-1,4-mannanase, a crucial enzyme for
CC       depolymerization of seed galactomannans and wood
CC       galactoglucomannans. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15541293,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:19205049}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Random hydrolysis of (1->4)-beta-D-mannosidic
CC       linkages in mannans, galactomannans and glucomannans.
CC   -!- BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES:
CC       Kinetic parameters:
CC         KM=3.07 mM for locust bean galactomannan
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15541293, ECO:0000269|PubMed:19205049};
CC         Vmax=1935 umol/min/mg enzyme {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15541293,
CC         ECO:0000269|PubMed:19205049};
CC       pH dependence:
CC         Optimum pH is 4.0 to 5.0. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15541293,
CC         ECO:0000269|PubMed:19205049};
CC       Temperature dependence:
CC         Optimum temperature is 65 degrees Celsius. Stable up to 55
CC         degrees Celsius. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15541293,
CC         ECO:0000269|PubMed:19205049};
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: Has a modular structure: a carbohydrate-binding module
CC       (CBM) at the N-terminus, a linker rich in serines, and a C-
CC       terminal endo-1,4-mannanase catalytic module. The genes for
CC       catalytic modules and CBMs seem to have evolved separately and
CC       have been linked by gene fusion.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the glycosyl hydrolase 5 (cellulase A)
CC       family. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 CBM1 (fungal-type carbohydrate-binding)
CC       domain. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00597}.

CC       Sequence=EAL85463.1; Type=Erroneous initiation; Note=Translation N-terminally shortened.; Evidence={ECO:0000305};

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Calcium-dependent lectin involved in innate immune
CC       defense. Binds mannose, fucose and N-acetylglucosamine on
CC       bacteria, including strains of A.suis, H.parasuis and
CC       A.pleuropneumoniae, and activates the lectin complement pathway.
CC       According to some authors, it only binds mannose (PubMed:8602463).
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16480769, ECO:0000269|PubMed:16518621,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:17284229, ECO:0000269|PubMed:8602463}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with MASP1 and MASP2 (By similarity). Forms
CC       oligomeric complexes of 3, 4, 5 or, predominantly, 6 homotrimers.
CC       The homotrimers appear as globular heads that are connected to a
CC       central hub by thin stalks. {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:P19999,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:16518621, ECO:0000269|PubMed:8602463}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed in liver. Weakly expressed in lung,
CC       testis and brain. Not detected in bone marrow and heart.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16480769, ECO:0000269|PubMed:17194476,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:17284229}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 C-type lectin domain. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00040}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 collagen-like domain. {ECO:0000255}.
CC   -!- CAUTION: Incorrectly identified as MBL2 by PubMed:11063327.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.

RP   FUNCTION, AND TISSUE SPECIFICITY.
RX   PubMed=17284229; DOI=10.1111/j.1744-313X.2007.00656.x;
RA   Phatsara C., Jennen D.G., Ponsuksili S., Murani E., Tesfaye D.,
RA   Schellander K., Wimmers K.;
RT   "Molecular genetic analysis of porcine mannose-binding lectin genes,
RT   MBL1 and MBL2, and their association with complement activity.";
RL   Int. J. Immunogenet. 34:55-63(2007).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Calcium-dependent lectin involved in innate immune
CC       defense. Binds mannose, fucose and N-acetylglucosamine on
CC       different microorganisms and activates the lectin complement
CC       pathway. Binds to late apoptotic cells, as well as to apoptotic
CC       blebs and to necrotic cells, but not to early apoptotic cells,
CC       facilitating their uptake by macrophages. According to some
CC       authors, it only binds mannose (PubMed:8602463).
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11298833, ECO:0000269|PubMed:17284229,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:8602463}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with MASP1 and MASP2. Interacts with MEP1A and
CC       MEP1B and may inhibit their catalytic activity (By similarity).
CC       Forms oligomeric complexes of 2 or 3 homotrimers.
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:P11226, ECO:0000269|PubMed:8602463}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:P11226}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed in liver. Weakly expressed in kidney
CC       and testis. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11298833,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:17194476, ECO:0000269|PubMed:17284229}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The coiled-coil domain mediates trimerization.
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 C-type lectin domain. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00040}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 2 collagen-like domains. {ECO:0000255}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Secreted metalloproteinase that allows assimilation of
CC       proteinaceous substrates. Pays a pivotal role as a pathogenicity
CC       determinant during infections and contributes to the ability of
CC       the pathogen to persist within the mammalian host. Digests an
CC       immunodominant cell surface antigen (SOWgp) and prevents host
CC       recognition of endospores during the phase of development when
CC       these fungal cells are most vulnerable to phagocytic cell
CC       defenses. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16177346}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16177346}.
CC   -!- INDUCTION: Peaks of expression occur during the endosporulation
CC       stage. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16177346}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the peptidase M43B family. {ECO:0000305}.
