RP   IDENTIFICATION BY MASS SPECTROMETRY, INDUCTION, AND SUBCELLULAR
RP   LOCATION.
RX   PubMed=21622905; DOI=10.1128/EC.05011-11;
RA   Sorgo A.G., Heilmann C.J., Dekker H.L., Bekker M., Brul S.,
RA   de Koster C.G., de Koning L.J., Klis F.M.;
RT   "Effects of fluconazole on the secretome, the wall proteome, and wall
RT   integrity of the clinical fungus Candida albicans.";
RL   Eukaryot. Cell 10:1071-1081(2011).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Surface mannoprotein required for hyphal morphogenesis,
CC       surface adherence, and pathogenicity. Contributes in a high
CC       proportion to the carbohydrate component of the matrix due to high
CC       levels of glycosylation and may play important roles during
CC       biofilm development and maintenance. Acts as a major antigen
CC       target of host cell-mediated immune response. Induces extensive T-
CC       cell proliferation of human peripheral blood mononuclear cells.
CC       Facilitates host dendritic cells maturation and promotes cytokine
CC       production through its glycosylated portion while its protein core
CC       is essentially involved in induction of T-cell response.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17217426}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Component of a multiprotein complex of 250 kDa composed
CC       of at least HYR1, MP65, and PRA1. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17277107}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted, cell wall
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15302828, ECO:0000269|PubMed:17277107,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:17905924, ECO:0000269|PubMed:19098294,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:21622905, ECO:0000269|PubMed:8698482}.
CC   -!- INDUCTION: Expressed predominantly by the mycelial cells. Also
CC       induced during cell wall regeneration and biofilm formation.
CC       Repressed by fluconazole. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16455273,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:21622905, ECO:0000269|PubMed:7738727}.
CC   -!- PTM: Glycosylated protein with a polysaccharide moiety composed
CC       exclusively of mannose and glucose at a ratio of 12.7 to 1.
CC       Contributes highly to the carbohydrate component of the matrix.
CC       Treatment with tunicamycin impairs glycosylation.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19098294}.
CC   -!- DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Impairs germ tube formation and suppresses
CC       hyphal formation. Decreases also pathogenicity and adherence to
CC       polystyrene plates. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17217426}.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: The presence of the MP65 gene can be used as a
CC       diagnostic marker to distinguish C.albicans from other yeast or
CC       Candida species by PCR.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the glycosyl hydrolase 17 family.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SEQUENCE CAUTION:
CC       Sequence=EAK95357.1; Type=Erroneous initiation; Note=Translation N-terminally extended.; Evidence={ECO:0000305};

RN   [2]
RP   NOMENCLATURE.
RX   PubMed=24184590; DOI=10.1016/j.peptides.2013.10.021;
RA   Almaaytah A., Albalas Q.;
RT   "Scorpion venom peptides with no disulfide bridges: a review.";
RL   Peptides 51:35-45(2014).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Displays significant potent antimicrobial activity
CC       against clinical isolates of Gram-negative multidrug resistant
CC       strains of E.coli, P.aeruginosa and A.baumanii with MIC values as
CC       low as 4.4 uM. Additionally, it displays low cytolytic and
CC       hemolytic activity against human erythrocytes reaching 50%
CC       hemolysis at 100 uM.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted {ECO:0000269|PubMed:20969885}.
CC       Target cell membrane {ECO:0000305|PubMed:20969885}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed by the venom gland. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- MASS SPECTROMETRY: Mass=4873; Method=Electrospray; Range=23-69;
CC       Evidence={ECO:0000269|PubMed:20969885};
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: Adopts the characteristic alpha-helical amphipatic
CC       structure in TFE solution, but an unexpected random coil
CC       conformation in water. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:20969885}.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: Is an unstable peptide when the venom is stored
CC       after milking. This produces a shorter peptide, named Vm36, which
CC       lacks the 8 amino acid residues at the N-terminus.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:20969885}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the non-disulfide-bridged peptide (NDBP)
CC       superfamily. Long chain multifunctional peptide (group 2) family.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Has antimicrobial activity against the Gram-positive
CC       bacteria S.aureus (MIC=8 uM) and the yeast C.albicans (MIC=16 uM).
CC       Causes hemolysis on horse erythrocytes (64 uM for 100% hemolysis).
CC       Minimum bactericidal concentrations have also been tested against
CC       S.aureus and is four-fold higher (MBC=32 uM).
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:25332684}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted {ECO:0000269|PubMed:25332684}.
CC       Target cell membrane {ECO:0000250}. Note=Forms a helical membrane
CC       channel in the prey. {ECO:0000250}.

CC       Evidence={ECO:0000269|PubMed:25332684};
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: Does not show antimicrobial activity against the
CC       Gram-negative bacteria E.coli (MIC>250 uM). Does not show effect
CC       on four different human cancer cell lines.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:25332684}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the non-disulfide-bridged peptide (NDBP)
CC       superfamily. Short antimicrobial peptide (group 4) family.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Plant non-specific lipid-transfer proteins transfer
CC       phospholipids as well as galactolipids across membranes. May play
CC       a role in wax or cutin deposition in the cell walls of expanding
CC       epidermal cells and certain secretory tissues (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q43748}.
CC   -!- BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES:
CC       pH dependence:
CC         Stable at pH 3. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:21462324};
CC       Temperature dependence:
CC         Stable up to 84 degrees Celsius. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:21462324};
CC   -!- PTM: Disulfide bonds. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:21462324}.
CC   -!- MASS SPECTROMETRY: Mass=9024.5; Method=Electrospray; Range=28-118;
CC       Evidence={ECO:0000269|PubMed:21462324};
CC   -!- ALLERGEN: Causes an allergic reaction in human. Binds to IgE.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:21462324, ECO:0000269|PubMed:21897872,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:23913675}.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: Found in celery but not in celeriac. Highly
CC       resistant to pepsin and other proteinases.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:21462324, ECO:0000269|PubMed:23913675}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the plant LTP family. {ECO:0000255}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Major component of the eggshell matrix. May play an
CC       important role in the regulation of calcite growth during eggshell
CC       calcification. May also regulate the mineralization process in
CC       developing and growing bones. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12225802,
CC       ECO:0000303|PubMed:10551857, ECO:0000303|PubMed:20665709}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted, extracellular space, extracellular
CC       matrix {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10551857}. Note=Synthesized and
CC       secreted by the granular epithelial cells of the uterus and
CC       incorporated into the eggshell matrix.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10551857}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: In the eggshell, expressed mainly in the
CC       palisade and mammillary layers. Expression also detected in the
CC       hypertrophic zone of the epiphyseal growth plate, and in cortical
CC       and medullary bone (at protein level). Highly expressed in uterus.
CC       Not detected in the proximal oviduct, liver, magnum, duodenum and
CC       kidney. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10551857, ECO:0000269|PubMed:18648057,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:20665709}.
CC   -!- DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE: Expressed at high levels at the middle of the
CC       calcification stage of shell formation. Expression levels are
CC       similar at 3-4 hours post-oviposition prior to entry of the egg
CC       into the uterus and at 16-17 hours post-oviposition during
CC       eggshell calcification. Expressed in tibia from E5 and in mandible
CC       from E7 until the end of embryonic development at E19. Expression
CC       detected first in osteoblasts, in later stages both in osteoblasts
CC       and osteocytes, and by the end of embryonic development mainly in
CC       osteocytes. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10551857,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:20665709}.
CC   -!- PTM: Asn-62 is fully glycosylated, whereas only less than 10% of
CC       Asn-293 seem to be glycosylated. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12225802}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the osteoregulin family. {ECO:0000255}.

RN   [5] {ECO:0000305}
RP   FUNCTION.
RX   PubMed=20570851;
RA   Nusnbaum M., Derby C.D.;
RT   "Effects of sea hare ink secretion and its escapin-generated
RT   components on a variety of predatory fishes.";
RL   Biol. Bull. 218:282-292(2010).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Catalyzes the oxidative deamination of positively
CC       charged L-amino acids L-Lys and L-Arg and, much less efficiently,
CC       of amino acids L-His and L-Tyr. Has antimicrobial activity.
CC       Inhibits growth of Gram-negative bacteria E.coli strain MC4100
CC       (MIC=0.62 ug/ml), E.coli strain C921-b2, S.typhimurium strain AA
CC       140 (MIC=0.62 ug/ml), P.aeruginosa strain PAO1 (MIC=0.31 ug/ml)
CC       and V.harveyi strain BB170 (MIC=0.25 ug/ml). Inhibits growth of
CC       Gram-positive bacteria S.aureus stain 6835 (MIC=0.31 ug/ml),
CC       S.pyogenes strain NZ131 (MIC=0.62 ug/ml), B.subtilis strain 168
CC       (MIC=2.50 ug/ml) and B.subtilis strain WB600 (MIC=2.50 ug/ml). The
CC       antibacterial effect can be bacteriostatic, mediated mostly by
CC       H(2)O(2), as well as bactericidal. The latter appears to be due to
CC       unstable intermediates generated from alpha-keto-epsilon-
CC       aminocaproic acid, an intermediate of escapin-deaminated L-Lys,
CC       and H(2)O(2). The bactericidal effect is stronger at lower pH
CC       levels. Intermediates generated from L-Arg have no bactericidal
CC       effect. Inhibits growth of yeast species S.cerevisiae strain
CC       BY4761 (MIC=5.0 ug/ml) and C.krusei (MIC=5.0 ug/ml). Inhibits
CC       growth of C.sphaerospermum in a lysine-dependent manner. As
CC       components of ink, products from escapin's enzymatic activity may
CC       play a role in deterring eukaryotic predators.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16155232, ECO:0000269|PubMed:18852282,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:20570851}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: An L-amino acid + H(2)O + O(2) = a 2-oxo acid
CC       + NH(3) + H(2)O(2). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16155232,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:18852282, ECO:0000269|PubMed:19130530}.
CC   -!- COFACTOR:
CC       Name=FAD; Xref=ChEBI:CHEBI:57692;
CC         Evidence={ECO:0000269|PubMed:16155232};
CC   -!- BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES:
CC       Kinetic parameters:
CC         KM=85.5 uM for L-Lys {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16155232};
CC         KM=120.5 uM for L-Arg {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16155232};
CC         Vmax=4.5 umol/sec/ug enzyme with L-Lys as substrate
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16155232};
CC         Vmax=5.5 umol/sec/ug enzyme with L-Arg as substrate
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16155232};
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16354780}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed exclusively in the ink gland. Within
CC       the ink gland, it is only detected in amber vesicles (at protein
CC       level). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16354780}.
CC   -!- PTM: Not glycosylated. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16155232}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the flavin monoamine oxidase family.
CC       {ECO:0000255}.

CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License

RP   PROTEIN SEQUENCE OF 19-27, AND IDENTIFICATION BY MASS SPECTROMETRY.
RC   TISSUE=Venom;
RX   PubMed=24231107; DOI=10.1016/j.jprot.2013.11.001;
RA   Margres M.J., McGivern J.J., Wray K.P., Seavy M., Calvin K.,

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Catalyzes an oxidative deamination of predominantly
CC       hydrophobic and aromatic L-amino acids (L-Leu), thus producing
CC       hydrogen peroxide that may contribute to the diverse toxic effects
CC       of this enzyme. Exhibits diverse biological activities, such as
CC       hemolysis, edema, hemorrhage, apoptosis, antibacterial and
CC       antiparasitic activities, as well as regulation of platelet
CC       aggregation. Effects of snake L-amino oxidases on platelets are
CC       controversial, since they either induce aggregation or inhibit
CC       agonist-induced aggregation. These different effects are probably
CC       due to different experimental conditions (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: An L-amino acid + H(2)O + O(2) = a 2-oxo acid
CC       + NH(3) + H(2)O(2).
CC   -!- COFACTOR:
CC       Name=FAD; Xref=ChEBI:CHEBI:57692; Evidence={ECO:0000250};
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homodimer; non-covalently linked. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed by the venom gland.
CC   -!- PTM: N-glycosylated. Glycosylation is needed for activity (By
CC       similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the flavin monoamine oxidase family. FIG1
CC       subfamily. {ECO:0000305}.

RP   SUBUNIT, AND GLYCOSYLATION.
RC   TISSUE=Venom, and Venom gland;
RX   PubMed=19135502; DOI=10.1016/j.biochi.2008.12.004;
RA   Rodrigues R.S., da Silva J.F., Boldrini Franca J., Fonseca F.P.,
RA   Otaviano A.R., Henrique Silva F., Hamaguchi A., Magro A.J., Braz A.S.,

RN   [2]
RP   PROTEIN SEQUENCE OF 19-34, AND IDENTIFICATION BY MASS SPECTROMETRY.
RC   TISSUE=Venom;
RX   PubMed=22480909; DOI=10.1016/j.jprot.2012.03.028;
RA   Rodrigues R.S., Boldrini-Franca J., Fonseca F.P., de la Torre P.,
RA   Henrique-Silva F., Sanz L., Calvete J.J., Rodrigues V.M.;
RT   "Combined snake venomics and venom gland transcriptomic analysis of
RT   Bothropoides pauloensis.";
RL   J. Proteomics 75:2707-2720(2012).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Catalyzes an oxidative deamination of predominantly
CC       hydrophobic and aromatic L-amino acids (highly against L-Met, L-
CC       Leu, L-Phe and L-Ile), thus producing hydrogen peroxide that may
CC       contribute to the diverse toxic effects of this enzyme. Exhibits
CC       diverse biological activities, such as antibacterial on both Gram-
CC       positive and Gram-negative bacteria and antiparasitic activities,
CC       as well as induction of platelet aggregation. Effects of snake L-
CC       amino oxidases on platelets are controversial, since they either
CC       induce aggregation or inhibit agonist-induced aggregation. These
CC       different effects are probably due to different experimental
CC       conditions. This protein may also have activities in hemorrhage,
CC       hemolysis, edema, and apoptosis. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19135502}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: An L-amino acid + H(2)O + O(2) = a 2-oxo acid
CC       + NH(3) + H(2)O(2).
CC   -!- COFACTOR:
CC       Name=FAD; Xref=ChEBI:CHEBI:57692; Evidence={ECO:0000250};
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homodimer; non-covalently linked.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19135502}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed by the venom gland.
CC   -!- PTM: N-glycosylated (Probable). The enzymatic activity is not
CC       affected by deglycosylation. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19135502,
CC       ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: Has parasiticidal activities against leishmania, as
CC       a result of enzyme-catalyzed hydrogen peroxide production.
CC       {ECO:0000305|PubMed:19135502}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the flavin monoamine oxidase family. FIG1
CC       subfamily. {ECO:0000305}.

RN   [2]
RP   PROTEIN SEQUENCE OF 20-36, FUNCTION, CATALYTIC ACTIVITY,
RP   BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES, AND SUBUNIT.
RC   TISSUE=Venom;
RX   PubMed=19393676; DOI=10.1016/j.toxicon.2009.04.017;
RA   Wei J.-F., Yang H.-W., Wei X.-L., Qiao L.-Y., Wang W.-Y., He S.-H.;
RT   "Purification, characterization and biological activities of the L-
RT   amino acid oxidase from Bungarus fasciatus snake venom.";
RL   Toxicon 54:262-271(2009).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Catalyzes an oxidative deamination of predominantly
CC       hydrophobic and aromatic L-amino acids (highly active against L-
CC       Tyr, L-Asp, L-Phe, L-Glu, L-Trp, L-His, L-Gln, L-Ile, L-Met, L-Leu
CC       and moderately active against L-Lys, L-Arg, L-Ala and L-Asn), thus
CC       producing hydrogen peroxide that may contribute to the diverse
CC       toxic effects of this enzyme. Exhibits diverse biological
CC       activities, such as edema, inflammatory cell infiltration,
CC       cytotoxicity and apoptosis, as well as induction of platelet
CC       aggregation. Effects of snake L-amino oxidases on platelets are
CC       controversial, since they either induce aggregation or inhibit
CC       agonist-induced aggregation. These different effects are probably
CC       due to different experimental conditions. This protein may also
CC       induce hemorrhage, hemolysis, and have antibacterial and
CC       antiparasitic activities. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19393676}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: An L-amino acid + H(2)O + O(2) = a 2-oxo acid
CC       + NH(3) + H(2)O(2). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19393676}.
CC   -!- COFACTOR:
CC       Name=FAD; Xref=ChEBI:CHEBI:57692; Evidence={ECO:0000250};
CC   -!- BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES:
CC       Kinetic parameters:
CC         KM=28.28 mM for L-Ala {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19393676};
CC         KM=18.75 mM for L-Arg {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19393676};
CC         KM=0.04 mM for L-Asp {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19393676};
CC         KM=19.07 mM for L-Asn {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19393676};
CC         KM=5.88 mM for L-Gln {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19393676};
CC         KM=1.44 mM for L-Glu {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19393676};
CC         KM=4.84 mM for L-His {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19393676};
CC         KM=1.64 mM for L-Ile {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19393676};
CC         KM=60.69 mM for L-Leu {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19393676};
CC         KM=21.49 mM for L-Lys {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19393676};
CC         KM=15.03 mM for L-Met {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19393676};
CC         KM=0.13 mM for L-Phe {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19393676};
CC         KM=0.27 mM for L-Trp {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19393676};
CC         KM=0.05 mM for L-Tyr {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19393676};
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Monomer. This is in contrast with most of its orthologs,
CC       that are non-covalently linked homodimers.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19393676}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed by the venom gland.
CC   -!- PTM: N-glycosylated. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the flavin monoamine oxidase family. FIG1
CC       subfamily. {ECO:0000305}.

RP   PROTEIN SEQUENCE OF 4-19, AND IDENTIFICATION BY MASS SPECTROMETRY.
RC   TISSUE=Venom;
RX   PubMed=18444672; DOI=10.1021/pr8000139;
RA   Lomonte B., Escolano J., Fernandez J., Sanz L., Angulo Y.,
RA   Gutierrez J.M., Calvete J.J.;
RT   "Snake venomics and antivenomics of the arboreal neotropical pitvipers
RT   Bothriechis lateralis and Bothriechis schlegelii.";
RL   J. Proteome Res. 7:2445-2457(2008).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Catalyzes an oxidative deamination of predominantly
CC       hydrophobic and aromatic L-amino acids (tested on L-Leu), thus
CC       producing hydrogen peroxide that may contribute to the diverse
CC       toxic effects of this enzyme. Damage cell membranes of the Gram-
CC       positive bacteria S.aureus (MIC=4 ug/ml and MBC=8 ug/ml) and the
CC       Gram-negative bacteria A.baumanni (MIC=2 ug/ml and MBC=4 ug/ml).
CC       This antibacterial activity is dependent on the production of
CC       hydrogen peroxyde, since it is inhibited by catalase, an hydrogen
CC       peroxyde scavenger. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:24875315}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: An L-amino acid + H(2)O + O(2) = a 2-oxo acid
CC       + NH(3) + H(2)O(2). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:24875315}.
CC   -!- BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES:
CC       Kinetic parameters:
CC         KM=16.37 uM for L-Leu {ECO:0000269|PubMed:24875315};
CC         Vmax=0.39 umol/min/mg enzyme {ECO:0000269|PubMed:24875315};
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Monomer. {ECO:0000303|PubMed:24875315}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted {ECO:0000269|PubMed:24875315}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed by the venom gland. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: Does not induce cytotoxicity to C2C12 cells (40
CC       ug/ml), peripheral blood mononuclear cells and to E.coli (200
CC       ug/ml). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:24875315}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the flavin monoamine oxidase family. FIG1
CC       subfamily. {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:B0VXW0}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Catalyzes an oxidative deamination of predominantly
CC       hydrophobic and aromatic L-amino acids (highest activity on L-
CC       Met>L-Leu>L-Phe>L-Trp=L-Ile), thus producing hydrogen peroxide
CC       that may contribute to the diverse toxic effects of this enzyme.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:25009089}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: An L-amino acid + H(2)O + O(2) = a 2-oxo acid
CC       + NH(3) + H(2)O(2). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:25009089}.
CC   -!- ENZYME REGULATION: Inhibited by the substrate analog N-acetyl
CC       tryptophan. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:25009089}.
CC   -!- BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES:
CC       Kinetic parameters:
CC         KM=0.10 mM for L-Met {ECO:0000269|PubMed:25009089};
CC         KM=0.25 mM for L-Leu {ECO:0000269|PubMed:25009089};
CC         KM=0.08 mM for L-Phe {ECO:0000269|PubMed:25009089};
CC       pH dependence:
CC         Optimum pH is 7.8. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:25009089};
CC       Temperature dependence:
CC         Optimum temperature is 50 degrees Celsius.
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:25009089};
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homodimer. {ECO:0000303|PubMed:25009089}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted {ECO:0000269|PubMed:25009089}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed by the venom gland. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- PTM: N-glycosylated (14%). The enzymatic activity remains
CC       unchanged after deglycosylation. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:25009089}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the flavin monoamine oxidase family. FIG1
CC       subfamily. {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:B0VXW0}.
CC   -!- CAUTION: Lacks two of the six Cys residues found in other family
CC       members, resulting in the lost of one disulfid bond.
CC       {ECO:0000303|PubMed:25009089}.

OS   Daboia russelii (Russel's viper) (Vipera russelii).

RN   [1]
RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [MRNA], PROTEIN SEQUENCE OF 19-38, FUNCTION,
RP   BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES, MUTAGENESIS OF HIS-241, MASS
RP   SPECTROMETRY, IDENTIFICATION BY MASS SPECTROMETRY, AND 3D-STRUCTURE
RP   MODELING IN COMPLEX WITH SUBSTRATE.
RC   STRAIN=Eastern India; TISSUE=Venom, and Venom gland;
RX   PubMed=21802487; DOI=10.1016/j.biochi.2011.07.022;
RA   Chen H.-S., Wang Y.-M., Huang W.-T., Huang K.-F., Tsai I.-H.;
RT   "Cloning, characterization and mutagenesis of Russell's viper venom L-
RT   amino acid oxidase: insights into its catalytic mechanism.";
RL   Biochimie 94:335-344(2012).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Catalyzes an oxidative deamination of predominantly
CC       hydrophobic and aromatic L-amino acids (L-Tyr followed by L-Phe,
CC       L-Met, L-Leu, L-Trp), thus producing hydrogen peroxide that may
CC       contribute to the diverse toxic effects of this enzyme. Inhibits
CC       ADP- and collagen-induced platelet aggregation. This inhibition is
CC       inhibited by catalase, indicating the importance of generated
CC       H(2)O(2) for the inhibitory effect. This effect on platelets among
CC       snake L-amino-acid oxidases is however controversial, since some
CC       of them induce aggregation, whereas the other inhibit agonist-
CC       induced aggregation. In vivo, this enzyme induces a rapid,
CC       substantial and reversible increase in the paw volume of mice
CC       (edema). In addition, myofibrosis, and inflammatory cell
CC       infiltration on the paw tissue are also observed.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:21802487}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: An L-amino acid + H(2)O + O(2) = a 2-oxo acid
CC       + NH(3) + H(2)O(2).
CC   -!- COFACTOR:
CC       Name=FAD; Xref=ChEBI:CHEBI:57692; Evidence={ECO:0000250};
CC   -!- BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES:
CC       Kinetic parameters:
CC         KM=0.081 mM for L-Tyr (at pH 7.5 and 25 degrees Celsius)
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:21802487};
CC         KM=0.142 mM for L-Phe (at pH 7.5 and 25 degrees Celsius)
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:21802487};
CC         KM=0.373 mM for L-Met (at pH 7.5 and 25 degrees Celsius)
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:21802487};
CC         KM=0.318 mM for L-Trp (at pH 7.5 and 25 degrees Celsius)
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:21802487};
CC         KM=0.490 mM for L-Leu (at pH 7.5 and 25 degrees Celsius)
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:21802487};
CC         KM=1.40 mM for L-Ile (at pH 7.5 and 25 degrees Celsius)
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:21802487};
CC         KM=12.20 mM for L-Arg (at pH 7.5 and 25 degrees Celsius)
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:21802487};
CC         KM=13.92 mM for L-Val (at pH 7.5 and 25 degrees Celsius)
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:21802487};
CC         KM=64.00 mM for L-Lys (at pH 7.5 and 25 degrees Celsius)
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:21802487};
CC         KM=116.48 mM for L-Ala (at pH 7.5 and 25 degrees Celsius)
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:21802487};
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homodimer; non-covalently linked. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed by the venom gland.
CC   -!- MASS SPECTROMETRY: Mass=62025; Method=MALDI; Range=19-504;
CC       Evidence={ECO:0000269|PubMed:21802487};
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: Does not induce dermal hemorrhage when
CC       subcutaneously injected into mice at the dose of 40 ug.
CC       {ECO:0000305|PubMed:21802487}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the flavin monoamine oxidase family. FIG1
CC       subfamily. {ECO:0000305}.

RA   Calvete J.J., Sanz L., Cid P., de la Torre P., Flores-Diaz M.,
RA   Dos Santos M.C., Borges A., Bremo A., Angulo Y., Lomonte B.,

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Catalyzes an oxidative deamination of predominantly
CC       hydrophobic and aromatic L-amino acids (tested on L-Leu), thus
CC       producing hydrogen peroxide that may contribute to the diverse
CC       toxic effects of this enzyme. Damages cell membranes of the Gram-
CC       positive bacteria S.aureus (MIC=8 ug/ml and MBC=16 ug/ml) and the
CC       Gram-negative bacteria A.baumannii (MIC=16 ug/ml and MBC=32
CC       ug/ml). This antimicrobial activity is dependent on the production
CC       of hydrogen peroxyde, since it is inhibited by catalase, an
CC       hydrogen peroxyde scavenger. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:23287728}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: An L-amino acid + H(2)O + O(2) = a 2-oxo acid
CC       + NH(3) + H(2)O(2). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:23287728}.
CC   -!- BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES:
CC       Kinetic parameters:
CC         KM=9.23 uM for L-Leu {ECO:0000269|PubMed:23287728};
CC         Vmax=0.46 uM/min/mg enzyme for L-Leu
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:23287728};
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Monomer. {ECO:0000303|PubMed:23287728}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted {ECO:0000269|PubMed:23287728}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed by the venom gland. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: Does not show antimicrobial activities against
CC       E.coli. Does not induce cytotoxicity toward C2C12 cells (at 40
CC       ug/ml) and peripheral blood mononuclear cells (up to 200 ug/ml).
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:23287728}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the flavin monoamine oxidase family. FIG1
CC       subfamily. {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:P56742}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Catalyzes an oxidative deamination of predominantly
CC       hydrophobic and aromatic L-amino acids (L-Met=L-Leu>>L-Phe>L-
CC       Trp>L-Tyr>L-Ile>L-His>L-Arg> L-Val>L-Gln,), thus producing
CC       hydrogen peroxide that may contribute to the diverse toxic effects
CC       of this enzyme. Exhibits a low myotoxicity (a mild myonecrosis is
CC       observed after injection in mice quadriceps muscle). In vitro, is
CC       cytotoxic to a lot of human cell lines, including AGS (IC(50)=22.7
CC       ug/ml), MCF-7 (IC(50)=1.4 ug/ml), HL-60, HeLa and Jurkat cells, as
CC       well as to the parasite Leishmania brasiliensis (IC(50)=2.22
CC       ug/ml). This cytotoxicity is dependent on the production of
CC       hydrogen peroxyde, since it is inhibited by catalase, an hydrogen
CC       peroxyde scavenger. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:22963728}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: An L-amino acid + H(2)O + O(2) = a 2-oxo acid
CC       + NH(3) + H(2)O(2). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:22963728}.
CC   -!- BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES:
CC       Kinetic parameters:
CC         KM=0.97 mM for L-Leu. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:22963728};
CC         Vmax=0.063 umol/min/mg enzyme for L-Leu.
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:22963728};
CC       pH dependence:
CC         Optimum pH is 8.0 for L-Leu. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:22963728};
CC       Temperature dependence:
CC         Optimum temperature is 4 degrees Celsius.
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:22963728};
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homodimer. {ECO:0000303|PubMed:22963728}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted {ECO:0000269|PubMed:22963728}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed by the venom gland. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- MASS SPECTROMETRY: Mass=60852; Method=MALDI; Range=19-516;
CC       Evidence={ECO:0000269|PubMed:22963728};
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: L-Lys and L-Ser are not substrate of this enzyme.
CC       This enzyme does not cause hemorrhage, paw edema morphological
CC       changes of heart, lung and kidney when injected into mice. Is not
CC       toxic to the parasite Trypanosoma cruzi.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:22963728}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the flavin monoamine oxidase family. FIG1
CC       subfamily. {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:B0VXW0}.
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------
CC   Copyrighted by the UniProt Consortium, see http://www.uniprot.org/terms
CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License

RN   [2]
RP   PROTEIN SEQUENCE OF 20-29, FUNCTION IN PLATELET AGGREGATION, AND
RP   BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES.
RC   TISSUE=Venom;
RX   PubMed=18180850; DOI=10.1111/j.1745-7270.2008.00372.x;
RA   Li R., Zhu S., Wu J., Wang W., Lu Q., Clemetson K.J.;
RT   "L-amino acid oxidase from Naja atra venom activates and binds to
RT   human platelets.";
RL   Acta Biochim. Biophys. Sin. 40:19-26(2008).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Catalyzes an oxidative deamination of predominantly
CC       hydrophobic and aromatic L-amino acids, thus producing hydrogen
CC       peroxide that may contribute to the diverse toxic effects of this
CC       enzyme. Exhibits diverse biological activities, such as
CC       hemorrhage, hemolysis, edema, apoptosis of vascular endothelial
CC       cells or tumor cell lines, antibacterial and antiparasitic
CC       activities (By similarity). This protein induces platelet
CC       aggregation by both hydrogen peroxide production and binding to
CC       platelet membrane proteins (that would enhance the sensitivity of
CC       platelets to hydrogen peroxide). Effects of snake L-amino oxidases
CC       on platelets are controversial, since they either induce
CC       aggregation or inhibit agonist-induced aggregation. These
CC       different effects are probably due to different experimental
CC       conditions. {ECO:0000250, ECO:0000269|PubMed:18180850}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: An L-amino acid + H(2)O + O(2) = a 2-oxo acid
CC       + NH(3) + H(2)O(2).
CC   -!- COFACTOR:
CC       Name=FAD; Xref=ChEBI:CHEBI:57692; Evidence={ECO:0000250};
CC   -!- BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES:
CC       Kinetic parameters:
CC         Vmax=38.4 umol/min/mg enzyme {ECO:0000269|PubMed:18180850};
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homodimer; non-covalently linked. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed by the venom gland.
CC   -!- PTM: N-glycosylated. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the flavin monoamine oxidase family. FIG1
CC       subfamily. {ECO:0000305}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Snake venom phospholipase A2 (PLA2) that exhibits high
CC       hydrolytic activities and shows strong preference for the anionic
CC       micelles (dPPC with deoxycholate) to the zwitterionic micelles
CC       (dPPC with Triton X-100). PLA2 catalyzes the calcium-dependent
CC       hydrolysis of the 2-acyl groups in 3-sn-phosphoglycerides.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17611171}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Phosphatidylcholine + H(2)O = 1-
CC       acylglycerophosphocholine + a carboxylate. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU10035, ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU10036}.
CC   -!- COFACTOR:
CC       Name=Ca(2+); Xref=ChEBI:CHEBI:29108; Evidence={ECO:0000250};
CC       Note=Binds 1 Ca(2+) ion. {ECO:0000250};
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed by the venom gland.
CC   -!- MASS SPECTROMETRY: Mass=13573; Method=Electrospray; Range=17-138;
CC       Note=in Drk-a1.; Evidence={ECO:0000269|PubMed:17611171};
CC   -!- MASS SPECTROMETRY: Mass=13812; Method=Electrospray; Range=17-138;
CC       Note=in Drk-a1' which has only its protein sequence AA 17-27
CC       sequenced.; Evidence={ECO:0000269|PubMed:17611171};
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the phospholipase A2 family. Group II
CC       subfamily. D49 sub-subfamily. {ECO:0000305}.

RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [MRNA], PROTEIN SEQUENCE OF 17-43, FUNCTION,
RP   CATALYTIC ACTIVITY, MASS SPECTROMETRY, LETHAL DOSE, AND CIRCULAR
RP   DICHROISM.
RC   TISSUE=Venom, and Venom gland;
RX   PubMed=21185324; DOI=10.1016/j.toxicon.2010.12.012;
RA   Tsai I.-H., Wang Y.M., Cheng A.C., Starkov V., Osipov A., Nikitin I.,
RA   Makarova Y., Ziganshin R., Utkin Y.;
RT   "cDNA cloning, structural, and functional analyses of venom
RT   phospholipases A and a Kunitz-type protease inhibitor from steppe
RT   viper Vipera ursinii renardi.";
RL   Toxicon 57:332-341(2011).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Snake venom phospholipase A2 that causes internal
CC       bleeding, shows very strong anticoagulant activities and inhibits
CC       ADP-induced platelet aggregation. Shows very low cytotoxicity.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:21185324}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Phosphatidylcholine + H(2)O = 1-
CC       acylglycerophosphocholine + a carboxylate. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU10035, ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU10036,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:21185324}.
CC   -!- COFACTOR:
CC       Name=Ca(2+); Xref=ChEBI:CHEBI:29108; Evidence={ECO:0000250};
CC       Note=Binds 1 Ca(2+) ion. {ECO:0000250};
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed by the venom gland.
CC   -!- MASS SPECTROMETRY: Mass=13547.9; Method=MALDI; Range=17-137;
CC       Evidence={ECO:0000269|PubMed:21185324};
CC   -!- TOXIC DOSE: LD(50) is 10.7 mg/kg by intraperitoneal injection into
CC       mice. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:21185324}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the phospholipase A2 family. Group II
CC       subfamily. D49 sub-subfamily. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- CAUTION: Two proteins (Vur-PL2A and Vur-PL2B) with different
CC       masses and detected in two different fractions have been isolated
CC       from the venom. They both seem to have the same sequence. Vur-PL2B
CC       is possibly a more stable conformer than Vur-PL2A. Since data on
CC       both proteins are very similar, information reported here only
CC       concern Vur-PL2B. {ECO:0000305}.

RN   [1]
RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [MRNA], PROTEIN SEQUENCE OF 17-39, FUNCTION,
RP   SUBUNIT, AND MASS SPECTROMETRY.
RC   TISSUE=Venom, and Venom gland;
RX   PubMed=15955061; DOI=10.1111/j.1742-4658.2005.04715.x;
RA   Wang Y.-M., Peng H.-F., Tsai I.-H.;
RT   "Unusual venom phospholipases A2 of two primitive tree vipers
RT   Trimeresurus puniceus and Trimeresurus borneensis.";
RL   FEBS J. 272:3015-3025(2005).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Snake venom phospholipase A2 (PLA2) that impairs
CC       hemostasis. It weakly inhibits ADP-induced platelet aggregation
CC       when tested on platelet rich plasma from human and rabbit blood
CC       (15-25% of inhibition at 5-10 ug of enzyme), and dose-dependently
CC       inhibits blood coagulation, possibly by inhibiting thrombin
CC       activation. Exhibits high hydrolytic activities toward L-
CC       dipalmitoyl phosphatidylcholine. PLA2 catalyzes the calcium-
CC       dependent hydrolysis of the 2-acyl groups in 3-sn-
CC       phosphoglycerides. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15955061}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Phosphatidylcholine + H(2)O = 1-
CC       acylglycerophosphocholine + a carboxylate. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU10035, ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU10036}.
CC   -!- COFACTOR:
CC       Name=Ca(2+); Xref=ChEBI:CHEBI:29108; Evidence={ECO:0000250};
CC       Note=Binds 1 Ca(2+) ion. {ECO:0000250};
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Monomer. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15955061}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed by the venom gland.
CC   -!- MASS SPECTROMETRY: Mass=13723.2; Method=Electrospray; Range=17-
CC       138; Evidence={ECO:0000269|PubMed:15955061};
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the phospholipase A2 family. Group II
CC       subfamily. D49 sub-subfamily. {ECO:0000305}.

DE   RecName: Full=Acidic phospholipase A2 Ts-A1;

DE   AltName: Full=Phosphatidylcholine 2-acylhydrolase;

OS   Trimeresurus stejnegeri (Chinese green tree viper) (Viridovipera
OS   stejnegeri).
OC   Eukaryota; Metazoa; Chordata; Craniata; Vertebrata; Euteleostomi;
OC   Lepidosauria; Squamata; Bifurcata; Unidentata; Episquamata;
OC   Toxicofera; Serpentes; Colubroidea; Viperidae; Crotalinae;
OC   Trimeresurus.
OX   NCBI_TaxID=39682;
RN   [1]
RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [MRNA], PROTEIN SEQUENCE OF 17-39, FUNCTION,
RP   DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE, AND MASS SPECTROMETRY.
RC   STRAIN=Taiwan; TISSUE=Venom, and Venom gland;
RX   PubMed=12959640; DOI=10.1042/BJ20030818;
RA   Tsai I.-H., Wang Y.-M., Chen Y.-H., Tsai T.-S., Tu M.-C.;
RT   "Venom phospholipases A2 of bamboo viper (Trimeresurus stejnegeri):
RT   molecular characterization, geographic variations and evidence of
RT   multiple ancestries.";
RL   Biochem. J. 377:215-223(2004).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Snake venom phospholipase A2 (PLA2) that shows a
CC       moderate inhibition of ADP-induced human platelet aggregation when
CC       tested on platelet rich plasma. Exhibits high hydrolytic
CC       activities and prefers the anionic micelles (dPPC with
CC       deoxycholate) to the zwitterionic micelles (dPPC with Triton X-
CC       100). PLA2 catalyzes the calcium-dependent hydrolysis of the 2-
CC       acyl groups in 3-sn-phosphoglycerides.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12959640}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Phosphatidylcholine + H(2)O = 1-
CC       acylglycerophosphocholine + a carboxylate. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU10035, ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU10036}.
CC   -!- COFACTOR:
CC       Name=Ca(2+); Xref=ChEBI:CHEBI:29108; Evidence={ECO:0000250};
CC       Note=Binds 1 Ca(2+) ion. {ECO:0000250};
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed by the venom gland.
CC   -!- DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE: Is expressed more abundantly in juvenile than
CC       in adult vipers. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12959640}.
CC   -!- MASS SPECTROMETRY: Mass=13734; Method=Electrospray; Range=17-138;
CC       Evidence={ECO:0000269|PubMed:12959640};
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the phospholipase A2 family. Group II
CC       subfamily. D49 sub-subfamily. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- CAUTION: According to PubMed:12959640, T.stejnegeri was formerly
CC       named T.gramineus, supposing that this protein is the same as PLA-
CC       I from T.gramineus. They have been kept separated, because
CC       T.gramineus and T.stejnegeri are considered as being two different
CC       species (see http://reptile-database.org/). {ECO:0000305}.

RN   [4]
RP   FUNCTION.
RX   PubMed=8711753; DOI=10.1016/0041-0101(95)00134-4;
RA   Thwin M.M., Gopalakrishnakone P., Yuen R., Tan C.H.;
RT   "Synaptosomal binding of 125I-labelled daboiatoxin, a new PLA2
RT   neurotoxin from the venom of Daboia russelli siamensis.";
RL   Toxicon 34:183-199(1996).
RN   [5]
RP   X-RAY CRYSTALLOGRAPHY (2.60 ANGSTROMS) OF 17-138, DISULFIDE BOND,
RP   SUBUNIT, AND TOXIC DOSE.
RC   TISSUE=Venom;
RX   PubMed=17505111; DOI=10.1107/S0907444907016204;
RA   Gopalan G., Thwin M.M., Gopalakrishnakone P., Swaminathan K.;
RT   "Structural and pharmacological comparison of daboiatoxin from Daboia
RT   russelli siamensis with viperotoxin F and vipoxin from other vipers.";
RL   Acta Crystallogr. D 63:722-729(2007).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Heterodimer (A and B chains): phospholipase A2 that acts
CC       as a presynaptic neurotoxin and shows a PLA2 activity of 1377
CC       umol/min/mg. In vivo, induces edema and produces neurotoxic
CC       symptoms in mice. Also exhibits indirect hemolysis, a strong
CC       myonecrotic activity and cytotoxicity. PLA2 catalyzes the calcium-
CC       dependent hydrolysis of the 2-acyl groups in 3-sn-
CC       phosphoglycerides.
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Monomer: Snake venom phospholipase A2 (PLA2) that shows
CC       a PLA2 activity of 578 umol/min/mg.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Phosphatidylcholine + H(2)O = 1-
CC       acylglycerophosphocholine + a carboxylate. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU10035, ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU10036}.
CC   -!- COFACTOR:
CC       Name=Ca(2+); Xref=ChEBI:CHEBI:29108; Evidence={ECO:0000250};
CC       Note=Binds 1 Ca(2+) ion. {ECO:0000250};
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Heterodimer of A and B chain; non-covalently linked. The
CC       acidic protein (B chain) has phospholipase A2 activity and the A
CC       chain weakly inhibits the B chain enzymatic activity but
CC       potentiates its lethal potency. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17505111}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed by the venom gland.
CC   -!- MASS SPECTROMETRY: Mass=13607; Method=Electrospray; Range=17-138;
CC       Note=in Dsm-a1.; Evidence={ECO:0000269|PubMed:17611171};
CC   -!- MASS SPECTROMETRY: Mass=13812; Method=Electrospray; Range=17-138;
CC       Note=in Dsm-a1' which has only its protein sequence AA 17-27
CC       sequenced.; Evidence={ECO:0000269|PubMed:17611171};
CC   -!- TOXIC DOSE: The lethal (intraperitoneal) dose of DbTx-B is
CC       estimated to be 0.5 ug/g, while that of the heterodimer is about
CC       0.1 ug/g. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17505111}.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: Does not provoke hemorrhage.
CC       {ECO:0000305|PubMed:7778130}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the phospholipase A2 family. Group II
CC       subfamily. D49 sub-subfamily. {ECO:0000305}.

OS   abyssus).

RN   [1]
RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [MRNA], PROTEIN SEQUENCE OF 17-39, FUNCTION,
RP   COFACTOR, AND MASS SPECTROMETRY.
RC   STRAIN=Southeastern Arizona; TISSUE=Venom, and Venom gland;
RX   PubMed=12623078; DOI=10.1016/S0003-9861(02)00747-6;
RA   Tsai I.-H., Wang Y.-M., Chen Y.-H., Tu A.T.;
RT   "Geographic variations, cloning, and functional analyses of the venom
RT   acidic phospholipases A2 of Crotalus viridis viridis.";
RL   Arch. Biochem. Biophys. 411:289-296(2003).
RN   [2]
RP   FUNCTION, CATALYTIC ACTIVITY, COFACTOR, BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES,
RP   SUBUNIT, MASS SPECTROMETRY, AND LETHAL DOSE.
RC   TISSUE=Venom;
RX   PubMed=24707493; DOI=10.1155/2014/654170;
RA   Martins W., Baldasso P.A., Honorio K.M., Maltarollo V.G.,
RA   Ribeiro R.I., Carvalho B.M., Soares A.M., Calderon L.A., Stabeli R.G.,
RA   Caballol M.A., Acosta G., Oliveira E., Marangoni S., Albericio F.,
RA   Da Silva S.L.;
RT   "A novel phospholipase A 2 (D49) from the venom of the Crotalus
RT   oreganus abyssus (North American Grand Canyon rattlesnake).";
RL   Biomed. Res. Int. 2014:1-14(2014).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Snake venom phospholipase A2 (PLA2) that shows very low
CC       inhibition of ADP-induced platelet aggregation in platelet-rich
CC       plasma of human, rabbit and guinea pig (PubMed:12623078). Shows
CC       edema-inducing activity and myotoxicity (PubMed:24707493). PLA2
CC       catalyzes the calcium-dependent hydrolysis of the 2-acyl groups in
CC       3-sn-phosphoglycerides. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12623078,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:24707493}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Phosphatidylcholine + H(2)O = 1-
CC       acylglycerophosphocholine + a carboxylate. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU10035, ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU10036,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:24707493}.
CC   -!- COFACTOR:
CC       Name=Ca(2+); Xref=ChEBI:CHEBI:29108;
CC         Evidence={ECO:0000269|PubMed:12623078,
CC         ECO:0000269|PubMed:24707493};
CC   -!- BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES:
CC       pH dependence:
CC         Optimum pH is 7.9. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:24707493};
CC       Temperature dependence:
CC         Optimum temperature is 37.3 degrees Celsius.
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:24707493};
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Dimer. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:24707493}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed by the venom gland.
CC   -!- MASS SPECTROMETRY: Mass=13782; Method=Electrospray; Range=17-138;
CC       Note=Monoisotopic mass.; Evidence={ECO:0000269|PubMed:12623078};
CC   -!- MASS SPECTROMETRY: Mass=13793.8; Method=MALDI; Range=17-138;
CC       Note=Average mass.; Evidence={ECO:0000269|PubMed:24707493};
CC   -!- TOXIC DOSE: LD(50) is 1.8 mg/kg by intravenous injection into
CC       mice. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:24707493}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the phospholipase A2 family. Group II
CC       subfamily. D49 sub-subfamily. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- CAUTION: PubMed:12623078 presents this protein as coming from
CC       C.viridis viridis, whereas PubMed:24707493 concludes it comes from
CC       C.oreganus abyssus due to identical sequences, very similar
CC       catalytic activity, and geographical origin. {ECO:0000305}.

RN   [1]
RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [MRNA], PROTEIN SEQUENCE OF 17-39, FUNCTION, AND
RP   MASS SPECTROMETRY.
RC   STRAIN=Chinese, and Taiwan; TISSUE=Venom, and Venom gland;
RX   PubMed=12959640; DOI=10.1042/BJ20030818;
RA   Tsai I.-H., Wang Y.-M., Chen Y.-H., Tsai T.-S., Tu M.-C.;
RT   "Venom phospholipases A2 of bamboo viper (Trimeresurus stejnegeri):
RT   molecular characterization, geographic variations and evidence of
RT   multiple ancestries.";
RL   Biochem. J. 377:215-223(2004).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Snake venom phospholipase A2 (PLA2) that shows a
CC       moderate inhibition of ADP-induced human platelet aggregation when
CC       tested on platelet rich plasma. Exhibits high hydrolytic
CC       activities and prefers the anionic micelles (dPPC with
CC       deoxycholate) to the zwitterionic micelles (dPPC with Triton X-
CC       100). PLA2 catalyzes the calcium-dependent hydrolysis of the 2-
CC       acyl groups in 3-sn-phosphoglycerides.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12959640}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Phosphatidylcholine + H(2)O = 1-
CC       acylglycerophosphocholine + a carboxylate. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU10035, ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU10036}.
CC   -!- COFACTOR:
CC       Name=Ca(2+); Xref=ChEBI:CHEBI:29108; Evidence={ECO:0000250};
CC       Note=Binds 1 Ca(2+) ion. {ECO:0000250};
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed by the venom gland.
CC   -!- MASS SPECTROMETRY: Mass=13939; Method=Electrospray; Range=17-138;
CC       Evidence={ECO:0000269|PubMed:12959640};
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the phospholipase A2 family. Group II
CC       subfamily. D49 sub-subfamily. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- CAUTION: According to PubMed:12959640, T.stejnegeri was formerly
CC       named T.gramineus, supposing that this protein is the same as PLA-
CC       VI from T.gramineus. They have been kept separated, because
CC       T.gramineus and T.stejnegeri are considered as being two different
CC       species (see http://reptile-database.org/). {ECO:0000305}.

ID   PA2A_BOTER              Reviewed;         138 AA.
AC   Q2HZ28;
DT   05-SEP-2012, integrated into UniProtKB/Swiss-Prot.
DT   07-MAR-2006, sequence version 1.
DT   07-JAN-2015, entry version 52.
DE   RecName: Full=Acidic phospholipase A2 BE-I-PLA2;
DE            Short=svPLA2;
DE            EC=3.1.1.4;
DE   AltName: Full=Phosphatidylcholine 2-acylhydrolase;
DE   Flags: Precursor;
OS   Bothrops erythromelas (Caatinga lance head).
OC   Eukaryota; Metazoa; Chordata; Craniata; Vertebrata; Euteleostomi;
OC   Lepidosauria; Squamata; Bifurcata; Unidentata; Episquamata;
OC   Toxicofera; Serpentes; Colubroidea; Viperidae; Crotalinae; Bothrops.
OX   NCBI_TaxID=44710;
RN   [1]
RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [MRNA], PROTEIN SEQUENCE OF 17-37; 78-91; 99-109
RP   AND 122-131, FUNCTION, AND MASS SPECTROMETRY.
RC   TISSUE=Venom, and Venom gland;
RX   PubMed=16750518; DOI=10.1016/j.bcp.2006.04.032;
RA   de Albuquerque Modesto J.C., Spencer P.J., Fritzen M., Valenca R.C.,
RA   Oliva M.L., da Silva M.B., Chudzinski-Tavassi A.M., Guarnieri M.C.;
RT   "BE-I-PLA2, a novel acidic phospholipase A2 from Bothrops erythromelas
RT   venom: isolation, cloning and characterization as potent anti-platelet
RT   and inductor of prostaglandin I2 release by endothelial cells.";
RL   Biochem. Pharmacol. 72:377-384(2006).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Snake venom phospholipase A2 that shows a potent
CC       inhibition of human platelet aggregation. This inhibition is
CC       concentration-dependent when aggregation is induced by collagen,
CC       and concentration-independent when aggregation is induced by
CC       arachidonic acid. In human umbilical-cord vein endothelial cells,
CC       this toxin stimulates endothelial cells to release prostaglandin
CC       I(2), suggesting an increase of its potential anti-platelet
CC       activity in vivo. PLA2 catalyzes the calcium-dependent hydrolysis
CC       of the 2-acyl groups in 3-sn-phosphoglycerides.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16750518}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Phosphatidylcholine + H(2)O = 1-
CC       acylglycerophosphocholine + a carboxylate. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU10035, ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU10036}.
CC   -!- COFACTOR:
CC       Name=Ca(2+); Xref=ChEBI:CHEBI:29108; Evidence={ECO:0000250};
CC       Note=Binds 1 Ca(2+) ion. {ECO:0000250};
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed by the venom gland.
CC   -!- MASS SPECTROMETRY: Mass=13649.57; Method=MALDI; Range=17-138;
CC       Evidence={ECO:0000269|PubMed:16750518};
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: Does not inhibit platelet aggregation when
CC       aggregation is induced by ADP, and does not induce aggregation of
CC       washed platelets. Does not induce changes on the principal
CC       platelet receptors (ITGA2, ITGA2B, GPIBA, SELP). In human
CC       umbilical-cord vein endothelial cells, does not induce detachment,
CC       does not interfere on nitric oxide release, and is neither
CC       apoptotic nor proliferative (PubMed:16750518).
CC       {ECO:0000305|PubMed:16750518}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the phospholipase A2 family. Group II
CC       subfamily. D49 sub-subfamily. {ECO:0000305}.

RP   X-RAY CRYSTALLOGRAPHY (1.79 ANGSTROMS) OF 17-138 IN COMPLEX WITH
RP   CALCIUM, SUBUNIT, AND DISULFIDE BOND.

RA   Magro A.J., Takeda A.A., Soares A.M., Fontes M.R.;
RT   "Structure of BthA-I complexed with p-bromophenacyl bromide: possible

RN   [6]
RP   X-RAY CRYSTALLOGRAPHY (0.97 ANGSTROMS) OF 17-138 IN COMPLEX WITH
RP   CALCIUM, AND DISULFIDE BOND.
RX   PubMed=16376474; DOI=10.1016/j.biochi.2005.10.014;
RA   Murakami M.T., Gabdoulkhakov A., Genov N., Cintra A.C.O., Betzel C.,
RA   Arni R.K.;
RT   "Insights into metal ion binding in phospholipases A2: ultra high-
RT   resolution crystal structures of an acidic phospholipase A2 in the
RT   Ca2+ free and bound states.";
RL   Biochimie 88:543-549(2006).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Snake venom phospholipase A2 (PLA2) that induces edema
CC       (activity that is inhibited by EDTA and dexamethasone), inhibits
CC       phospholipid-dependent collagen/ADP-induced platelet aggregation,
CC       possess hypotensive as well as anticoagulant activities. In
CC       addition, this enzyme shows bactericidal activity against E.coli
CC       and S.aureus. PLA2 catalyzes the calcium-dependent hydrolysis of
CC       the 2-acyl groups in 3-sn-phosphoglycerides.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12167491, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15214498}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Phosphatidylcholine + H(2)O = 1-
CC       acylglycerophosphocholine + a carboxylate. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU10035, ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU10036,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:12167491}.
CC   -!- COFACTOR:
CC       Name=Ca(2+); Xref=ChEBI:CHEBI:29108;
CC       Note=Binds 1 Ca(2+) ion per subunit.;
CC   -!- ENZYME REGULATION: Inhibited by EDTA and BPB.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15214498}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homodimer; non-covalently linked.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15214498, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15351695,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:16376474}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12167491,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:15214498}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed by the venom gland.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12167491, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15214498}.
CC   -!- TOXIC DOSE: LD(50) show no toxicity when injected into mice: 25
CC       mg/kg by intraperitoneal injection, 7.5 mg/kg by intravenous
CC       injection, and 0.5 mg/kg by intracerebroventricular injection.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12167491}.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: This enzyme has been found to be not myotoxic, not
CC       cytotoxic, not hemorrhagic and not lethal.
CC       {ECO:0000305|PubMed:12167491}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the phospholipase A2 family. Group II
CC       subfamily. D49 sub-subfamily. {ECO:0000305}.

DE   RecName: Full=Acidic phospholipase A2 Tbo-E6;
DE            Short=svPLA2;
DE            EC=3.1.1.4;
DE   AltName: Full=Phosphatidylcholine 2-acylhydrolase;
DE   Flags: Precursor;
OS   Trimeresurus borneensis (Borneo pit viper).
OC   Eukaryota; Metazoa; Chordata; Craniata; Vertebrata; Euteleostomi;
OC   Lepidosauria; Squamata; Bifurcata; Unidentata; Episquamata;
OC   Toxicofera; Serpentes; Colubroidea; Viperidae; Crotalinae;
OC   Trimeresurus.
OX   NCBI_TaxID=109778;
RN   [1]
RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [MRNA], PROTEIN SEQUENCE OF 17-39, FUNCTION,
RP   SUBUNIT, AND MASS SPECTROMETRY.
RC   TISSUE=Venom, and Venom gland;
RX   PubMed=15955061; DOI=10.1111/j.1742-4658.2005.04715.x;
RA   Wang Y.-M., Peng H.-F., Tsai I.-H.;
RT   "Unusual venom phospholipases A2 of two primitive tree vipers
RT   Trimeresurus puniceus and Trimeresurus borneensis.";
RL   FEBS J. 272:3015-3025(2005).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Snake venom phospholipase A2 (PLA2) that impairs
CC       hemostasis. It weakly inhibits ADP-induced platelet aggregation
CC       when tested on platelet rich plasma from human and rabbit blood
CC       (15-25% of inhibition at 5-10 ug of enzyme), and dose-dependently
CC       inhibits blood coagulation, possibly by inhibiting thrombin
CC       activation. Exhibits high hydrolytic activities toward L-
CC       dipalmitoyl phosphatidylcholine. PLA2 catalyzes the calcium-
CC       dependent hydrolysis of the 2-acyl groups in 3-sn-
CC       phosphoglycerides. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15955061}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Phosphatidylcholine + H(2)O = 1-
CC       acylglycerophosphocholine + a carboxylate. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU10035, ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU10036}.
CC   -!- COFACTOR:
CC       Name=Ca(2+); Xref=ChEBI:CHEBI:29108; Evidence={ECO:0000250};
CC       Note=Binds 1 Ca(2+) ion. {ECO:0000250};
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Monomer. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15955061}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed by the venom gland.
CC   -!- MASS SPECTROMETRY: Mass=13723.0; Method=Electrospray; Range=17-
CC       138; Evidence={ECO:0000269|PubMed:15955061};
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the phospholipase A2 family. Group II
CC       subfamily. D49 sub-subfamily. {ECO:0000305}.

ID   PA2A_TRIGS              Reviewed;         139 AA.
AC   A8E2V8;
DT   05-SEP-2012, integrated into UniProtKB/Swiss-Prot.
DT   13-NOV-2007, sequence version 1.
DT   26-NOV-2014, entry version 37.
DE   RecName: Full=Acidic phospholipase A2 Tgc-E6;
DE            Short=svPLA2;
DE            EC=3.1.1.4;
DE   AltName: Full=Phosphatidylcholine 2-acylhydrolase;
DE   Flags: Precursor;
OS   Trimeresurus gracilis (Kikuchi habu).
OC   Eukaryota; Metazoa; Chordata; Craniata; Vertebrata; Euteleostomi;
OC   Lepidosauria; Squamata; Bifurcata; Unidentata; Episquamata;
OC   Toxicofera; Serpentes; Colubroidea; Viperidae; Crotalinae;
OC   Trimeresurus.
OX   NCBI_TaxID=109781;
RN   [1]
RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [MRNA], PROTEIN SEQUENCE OF 17-46, FUNCTION,
RP   SUBUNIT, AND MASS SPECTROMETRY.
RC   TISSUE=Venom, and Venom gland;
RX   PubMed=22115990; DOI=10.1016/j.toxicon.2011.10.016;
RA   Tsai I.-H., Tsai T.-S., Wang Y.-M., Tu M.-C., Chang H.-C.;
RT   "Cloning and characterization of Trimeresurus gracilis venom
RT   phospholipases A(2): comparison with Ovophis okinavensis venom and the
RT   systematic implications.";
RL   Toxicon 59:151-157(2012).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Snake venom phospholipase A2 (PLA2) that inhibits the
CC       ADP-(IC(50)=272 nM) and collagen-induced (IC(50)=518 nM) human
CC       platelet aggregation in platelet rich plasma. Exhibits very high
CC       hydrolytic activities toward the synthetic lecithin, and prefers
CC       the anionic micelles (dPPC with deoxycholate) to the zwitterionic
CC       micelles (dPPC with Triton X-100). PLA2 catalyzes the calcium-
CC       dependent hydrolysis of the 2-acyl groups in 3-sn-
CC       phosphoglycerides. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:22115990}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Snake venom phospholipase A2 (PLA2) that displays an
CC       inhibitory effect, independent from its catalytic activity, on
CC       tumor cell adhesion and migration. This effect is mediated via
CC       specific inhibition of integrins alpha-5/beta-1 (ITGA5/ITGB1),
CC       alpha-v/beta-3 (ITGAV/ITGB3) and alpha-v/beta-6 (ITGAV/ITGB6).
CC       PLA2 catalyzes the calcium-dependent hydrolysis of the 2-acyl
CC       groups in 3-sn-phosphoglycerides. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19351557}.

CC       ProRule:PRU10035, ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU10036}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed by the venom gland.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: The sequence shown is that of PeBP(R)-I. PeBP(R)-II
CC       differs at two positions.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: Does not show hemorrhagic activity.
CC       {ECO:0000305|PubMed:16962627}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the phospholipase A2 family. Group II
CC       subfamily. R49 sub-subfamily. {ECO:0000305}.

RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [GENOMIC DNA].
RC   TISSUE=Liver;
RX   PubMed=7777556; DOI=10.1073/pnas.92.12.5605;
RA   Nakashima K., Nobuhisa I., Deshimaru M., Nakai M., Ogawa T.,

RA   Ohno M.;

RN   [4]
RP   PROTEIN SEQUENCE OF 17-138, FUNCTION, AND COFACTOR.
RC   TISSUE=Venom;
RX   PubMed=2330604; DOI=10.1016/0041-0101(90)90005-R;
RA   Yoshizumi K., Liu S.-Y., Miyata T., Saita S., Ohno M., Iwanaga S.,
RA   Kihara H.;
RT   "Purification and amino acid sequence of basic protein I, a lysine-49-
RT   phospholipase A2 with low activity, from the venom of Trimeresurus
RT   flavoviridis (Habu snake).";
RL   Toxicon 28:43-54(1990).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Snake venom phospholipase A2 (PLA2) that has strong
CC       myotoxic activity with a low phospholipase A2 activity. PLA2
CC       catalyzes the calcium-dependent hydrolysis of the 2-acyl groups in
CC       3-sn-phosphoglycerides. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:2330604}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Phosphatidylcholine + H(2)O = 1-
CC       acylglycerophosphocholine + a carboxylate. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU10035, ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU10036}.
CC   -!- COFACTOR:
CC       Name=Ca(2+); Xref=ChEBI:CHEBI:29108;
CC         Evidence={ECO:0000269|PubMed:2330604};
CC       Note=Binds 1 Ca(2+) ion. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:2330604};
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed by the venom gland.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: Is abundantly expressed in Tokunoshima and Amami-
CC       Oshima P.flavoviridis venom, but is missing in Okinawa
CC       P.flavoviridis venom. It is thought that loss of BP-I in Okinawa
CC       P.flavoviridis is due to lack of necessity for a strong toxicity
CC       exerted by BP-I in the venom as far as they feed mostly on frogs.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the phospholipase A2 family. Group II
CC       subfamily. K49 sub-subfamily. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- CAUTION: Binds calcium very weakly as one of the calcium-binding
CC       ligands is lost (Asp->Lys in position 64, which corresponds to
CC       'Lys-49' in the current nomenclature). {ECO:0000305}.

RN   [6]
RP   FUNCTION, AND IDENTIFICATION BY MASS SPECTROMETRY.
RC   STRAIN=Amami-Oshima, and Tokunoshima; TISSUE=Venom;
RX   PubMed=19463843; DOI=10.1016/j.toxicon.2009.05.003;
RA   Murakami T., Kariu T., Takazaki S., Hattori S., Chijiwa T., Ohno M.,
RA   Oda-Ueda N.;
RT   "Island specific expression of a novel [Lys(49)]phospholipase A(2)
RT   (BPIII) in Protobothrops flavoviridis venom in Amami-Oshima, Japan.";
RL   Toxicon 54:399-407(2009).
RN   [7]
RP   ERRATUM.
RA   Murakami T., Kariu T., Takazaki S., Hattori S., Chijiwa T., Ohno M.,
RA   Oda-Ueda N.;
RL   Toxicon 55:171-172(2010).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Snake venom phospholipase A2 (PLA2) that shows
CC       anticoagulant activities, strong myolytic activity, infiltration
CC       of polymorphonuclear cells, and edema in stromal tissues. Induces
CC       cell death of Jurkat cells in a concentration dependent manner.
CC       Shows a low phospholipase A2 activity. PLA2 catalyzes the calcium-
CC       dependent hydrolysis of the 2-acyl groups in 3-sn-
CC       phosphoglycerides. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19463843,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:2341374}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Phosphatidylcholine + H(2)O = 1-
CC       acylglycerophosphocholine + a carboxylate. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU10035, ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU10036}.
CC   -!- COFACTOR:
CC       Name=Ca(2+); Xref=ChEBI:CHEBI:29108;
CC         Evidence={ECO:0000269|PubMed:2341374};
CC       Note=Binds 1 Ca(2+) ion. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:2341374};
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed by the venom gland.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: Is abundantly expressed in Tokunoshima and Amami-
CC       Oshima P.flavoviridis venom, but is missing in Okinawa
CC       P.flavoviridis venom. It is thought that loss of BP-II in Okinawa
CC       P.flavoviridis is due to lack of necessity for a strong toxicity
CC       exerted by BP-II in the venom as far as they feed mostly on frogs.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the phospholipase A2 family. Group II
CC       subfamily. K49 sub-subfamily. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- CAUTION: Binds calcium very weakly as one of the calcium-binding
CC       ligands is lost (Asp->Lys in position 64, which corresponds to
CC       'Lys-49' in the current nomenclature). {ECO:0000305}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Snake venom phospholipase A2 (PLA2) that shows
CC       presynaptic neurotoxicity. PLA2 catalyzes the calcium-dependent
CC       hydrolysis of the 2-acyl groups in 3-sn-phosphoglycerides.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15032748}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Phosphatidylcholine + H(2)O = 1-
CC       acylglycerophosphocholine + a carboxylate. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU10035, ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU10036}.
CC   -!- COFACTOR:
CC       Name=Ca(2+); Xref=ChEBI:CHEBI:29108; Evidence={ECO:0000250};
CC       Note=Binds 1 Ca(2+) ion. {ECO:0000250};
CC   -!- BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES:
CC       Kinetic parameters:
CC         Vmax=385 umol/min/mg enzyme with DPPC + deoxycholate as
CC         substrate (at pH 7.4 and 37 degrees Celsius)
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15032748};
CC         Vmax=192 umol/min/mg enzyme with DPPC + Triton X-100 as
CC         substrate (at pH 7.4 and 37 degrees Celsius)
CC         {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15032748};
CC         Note=When tested as a monomer.;
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Heterodimer of an acidic subunit and a basic chain. The
CC       acidic subunit is non-toxic, without enzymatic activity and
CC       comprises 3 peptides that are cross-linked by 7 disulfide bridges.
CC       The basic subunit is toxic, has phospholipase A2 activity and is
CC       composed of a single chain. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15032748}.

CC       subfamily. D49 sub-subfamily. {ECO:0000305}.

DE   RecName: Full=Basic phospholipase A2 Tbo-G6D49;
DE            Short=svPLA2;
DE            EC=3.1.1.4;
DE   AltName: Full=Phosphatidylcholine 2-acylhydrolase;
DE   Flags: Precursor;
OS   Trimeresurus borneensis (Borneo pit viper).
OC   Eukaryota; Metazoa; Chordata; Craniata; Vertebrata; Euteleostomi;
OC   Lepidosauria; Squamata; Bifurcata; Unidentata; Episquamata;
OC   Toxicofera; Serpentes; Colubroidea; Viperidae; Crotalinae;
OC   Trimeresurus.
OX   NCBI_TaxID=109778;
RN   [1]
RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [MRNA], PROTEIN SEQUENCE OF 17-39, FUNCTION,
RP   SUBUNIT, AND MASS SPECTROMETRY.
RC   TISSUE=Venom, and Venom gland;
RX   PubMed=15955061; DOI=10.1111/j.1742-4658.2005.04715.x;
RA   Wang Y.-M., Peng H.-F., Tsai I.-H.;
RT   "Unusual venom phospholipases A2 of two primitive tree vipers
RT   Trimeresurus puniceus and Trimeresurus borneensis.";
RL   FEBS J. 272:3015-3025(2005).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Snake venom phospholipase A2 (PLA2) that impairs
CC       hemostasis. It weakly inhibits ADP-induced platelet aggregation
CC       when tested on platelet rich plasma from human and rabbit blood
CC       (15-25% of inhibition at 5-10 ug of enzyme), and dose-dependently
CC       inhibits blood coagulation, possibly by inhibiting thrombin
CC       activation. Exhibits strong hydrolytic activities toward L-
CC       dipalmitoyl phosphatidylcholine. PLA2 catalyzes the calcium-
CC       dependent hydrolysis of the 2-acyl groups in 3-sn-
CC       phosphoglycerides. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15955061}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Phosphatidylcholine + H(2)O = 1-
CC       acylglycerophosphocholine + a carboxylate. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU10035, ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU10036}.
CC   -!- COFACTOR:
CC       Name=Ca(2+); Xref=ChEBI:CHEBI:29108; Evidence={ECO:0000250};
CC       Note=Binds 1 Ca(2+) ion. {ECO:0000250};
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Monomer. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15955061}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed by the venom gland.
CC   -!- MASS SPECTROMETRY: Mass=13959.6; Method=Electrospray; Range=17-
CC       138; Evidence={ECO:0000269|PubMed:15955061};
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the phospholipase A2 family. Group II
CC       subfamily. D49 sub-subfamily. {ECO:0000305}.

DE            Short=svPLA2 homolog;

OS   Protobothrops mucrosquamatus (Taiwan habu) (Trimeresurus
OS   mucrosquamatus).
OC   Eukaryota; Metazoa; Chordata; Craniata; Vertebrata; Euteleostomi;
OC   Lepidosauria; Squamata; Bifurcata; Unidentata; Episquamata;
OC   Toxicofera; Serpentes; Colubroidea; Viperidae; Crotalinae;
OC   Protobothrops.
OX   NCBI_TaxID=103944;
RN   [1]
RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [MRNA], PROTEIN SEQUENCE OF 17-40, FUNCTION, AND
RP   MASS SPECTROMETRY.
RC   STRAIN=Hunan; TISSUE=Venom, and Venom gland;
RX   PubMed=16413680; DOI=10.1016/j.bbagen.2005.11.022;
RA   Wei J.-F., Wei X.-L., Chen Q.-Y., Huang T., Qiao L.-Y., Wang W.-Y.,
RA   Xiong Y.-L., He S.-H.;
RT   "N49 phospholipase A2, a unique subgroup of snake venom group II
RT   phospholipase A2.";
RL   Biochim. Biophys. Acta 1760:462-471(2006).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Snake venom phospholipase A2 (PLA2) that exhibits potent
CC       myotoxic activity causing inflammatory cell infiltration, severe
CC       myoedema, myonecrosis and myolysis in the gastrocnemius muscles of
CC       BALB/c mice. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16413680}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homodimer; non-covalently linked. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed by the venom gland.
CC   -!- MASS SPECTROMETRY: Mass=13875; Method=MALDI; Range=17-138;
CC       Evidence={ECO:0000269|PubMed:16413680};
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: Does not possess enzymatic, hemolytic and
CC       hemorrhagic activities. Fails to induce platelet aggregation by
CC       itself, and does not inhibit ADP-induced platelet aggregation
CC       (PubMed:16413680). {ECO:0000305|PubMed:16413680}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the phospholipase A2 family. Group II
CC       subfamily. N49 sub-subfamily. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- CAUTION: Does not bind calcium as one of the calcium-binding
CC       ligands is lost (Asp->Asn in position 64, which corresponds to
CC       'Asn-49' in the current nomenclature). {ECO:0000305}.

ID   PA2HB_MICTN             Reviewed;         149 AA.
AC   G9I930;
DT   18-APR-2012, integrated into UniProtKB/Swiss-Prot.
DT   22-FEB-2012, sequence version 1.
DT   07-JAN-2015, entry version 20.
DE   RecName: Full=Basic phospholipase A2 homolog Tx-beta;
DE            Short=svPLA2 homolog;
DE   AltName: Full=MitTx-beta;
DE   Flags: Precursor;
OS   Micrurus tener tener (Texas coral snake).
OC   Eukaryota; Metazoa; Chordata; Craniata; Vertebrata; Euteleostomi;
OC   Lepidosauria; Squamata; Bifurcata; Unidentata; Episquamata;
OC   Toxicofera; Serpentes; Colubroidea; Elapidae; Elapinae; Micrurus.
OX   NCBI_TaxID=1114302;
RN   [1]
RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [MRNA], PROTEIN SEQUENCE OF N-TERMINUS, FUNCTION,
RP   AND SUBUNIT.
RC   TISSUE=Venom, and Venom gland;
RX   PubMed=22094702; DOI=10.1038/nature10607;
RA   Bohlen C.J., Chesler A.T., Sharif-Naeini R., Medzihradszky K.F.,
RA   Zhou S., King D., Sanchez E.E., Burlingame A.L., Basbaum A.I.,
RA   Julius D.;
RT   "A heteromeric Texas coral snake toxin targets acid-sensing ion
RT   channels to produce pain.";
RL   Nature 479:410-414(2011).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Heterodimer: snake venom phospholipase that potently
CC       activates mouse H(+)-gated sodium channel ASIC1/ACCN2 (acid-
CC       sensitive ion channel 1) expressed in Xenopus oocytes. Both
CC       alternatively spliced isoforms ASIC1a and ASIC1b are activated,
CC       with a higher potency for ASIC1a (EC(50)=9.4 nM) vs ASIC1b
CC       (EC(50)=23 nM). The ASIC3/ACCN3 subtype is also sensitive to the
CC       heterodimer, but with a lower potency (EC(50)=830 nM). On
CC       ASIC2a/ACCN1, the toxin shows a very weak activation, but produces
CC       a remarkable potentiation (>100-fold) of protons when the
CC       extracellular pH drops below neutrality. The toxin interacts with
CC       the extracellular region of the channel, since responses are only
CC       observed in the outside-out configuration. In vivo, the
CC       heterodimer elicits robust pain-related behavior in mice by
CC       activation of ASIC1/ACCN2 channels on capsaicin-sensitive nerve
CC       fibers. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:22094702}.
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Monomer: does not have phospholipase A2 activity but may
CC       maintain some lipid-binding character from its PLA2 lineage, which
CC       could aid in effecting neuronal depolarization.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:22094702}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Heterodimer of an alpha and a beta chains.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:22094702}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed by the venom gland.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: This toxin has been studied to probe molecular
CC       mechanisms underlying pain sensation. By targeting ASIC1/ACCN2, it
CC       reveals an unexpected contribution of this channel to nociception.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: The heterodimeric toxin does not affect
CC       ASIC2b/ACCN1, ASIC4/ACCN4, Kv2.1/KCNB1, Cav3.3/CACNA1I,
CC       ENaC/SCNN1A, TRPA1, TRPV1, TRPV3, TRPM8, P2X2/P2RX2, and 5-
CC       HT3/HTR3A channels. {ECO:0000305|PubMed:22094702}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the phospholipase A2 family. Group I
CC       subfamily. K49 sub-subfamily. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- WEB RESOURCE: Name=Protein Spotlight; Note=The poison in pain -
CC       Issue 140 of July 2012;
CC       URL="http://web.expasy.org/spotlight/back_issues/140";
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------
CC   Copyrighted by the UniProt Consortium, see http://www.uniprot.org/terms
CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------

OX   NCBI_TaxID=39682;
RN   [1]
RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [MRNA], PROTEIN SEQUENCE OF 17-39, FUNCTION,
RP   DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE, AND MASS SPECTROMETRY.
RC   STRAIN=Chinese, and Taiwan; TISSUE=Venom, and Venom gland;
RX   PubMed=12959640; DOI=10.1042/BJ20030818;
RA   Tsai I.-H., Wang Y.-M., Chen Y.-H., Tsai T.-S., Tu M.-C.;
RT   "Venom phospholipases A2 of bamboo viper (Trimeresurus stejnegeri):
RT   molecular characterization, geographic variations and evidence of
RT   multiple ancestries.";
RL   Biochem. J. 377:215-223(2004).
RN   [2]
RP   PROTEIN SEQUENCE OF 17-32.
RC   TISSUE=Venom;
RA   Li S.-Y., Guo Z.-X., Yang Y.-Y., Wang W.-Y., Xiong Y.-L.;
RT   "Isolation and sequencing of five variants of phospholipase A2 from
RT   venom of snake Trimeresurus stejnegeri.";
RL   J. Hubei Univ. 25:63-68(2003).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Snake venom phospholipase A2 homolog that induces local
CC       edema a few hours after injection (5-10 ug) in the hind paw and
CC       shows weak anticoagulant and myotoxic activities.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12959640}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed by the venom gland.
CC   -!- DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE: Is expressed more abundantly in adult than in
CC       juvenile vipers. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12959640}.
CC   -!- MASS SPECTROMETRY: Mass=13689; Method=Electrospray; Range=17-137;
CC       Evidence={ECO:0000269|PubMed:12959640};
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the phospholipase A2 family. Group II
CC       subfamily. N49 sub-subfamily. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- CAUTION: Does not bind calcium as one of the calcium-binding
CC       ligands is lost (Asp->Asn in position 64, which corresponds to
CC       'Asn-49' in the current nomenclature). {ECO:0000305}.

OC   Trimeresurus.
OX   NCBI_TaxID=39682;
RN   [1]
RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [MRNA], PROTEIN SEQUENCE OF 17-39, FUNCTION, AND
RP   MASS SPECTROMETRY.
RC   STRAIN=Taiwan; TISSUE=Venom, and Venom gland;
RX   PubMed=12959640; DOI=10.1042/BJ20030818;
RA   Tsai I.-H., Wang Y.-M., Chen Y.-H., Tsai T.-S., Tu M.-C.;
RT   "Venom phospholipases A2 of bamboo viper (Trimeresurus stejnegeri):
RT   molecular characterization, geographic variations and evidence of
RT   multiple ancestries.";
RL   Biochem. J. 377:215-223(2004).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Snake venom phospholipase A2 homolog that induces local
CC       edema a few hours after injection (5-10 ug) in the hind paw, and
CC       shows weak anticoagulant and myotoxic activities.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12959640}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed by the venom gland.
CC   -!- MASS SPECTROMETRY: Mass=13892; Method=Electrospray; Range=17-138;
CC       Evidence={ECO:0000269|PubMed:12959640};
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the phospholipase A2 family. Group II
CC       subfamily. K49 sub-subfamily. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- CAUTION: Does not bind calcium as one of the calcium-binding
CC       ligands is lost (Asp->Lys in position 64, which corresponds to
CC       'Lys-49' in the current nomenclature). {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- CAUTION: According to PubMed:12959640, T.stejnegeri was formerly
CC       named T.gramineus, supposing that this protein is the same as PLA-
CC       V from T.gramineus. They have been kept separated, because
CC       T.gramineus and T.stejnegeri are considered as being two different
CC       species (see http://reptile-database.org/). {ECO:0000305}.

OC   Protobothrops.
OX   NCBI_TaxID=103944;
RN   [1]
RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [MRNA], PROTEIN SEQUENCE OF 17-46, FUNCTION,
RP   SUBUNIT, AND MASS SPECTROMETRY.
RC   TISSUE=Venom, and Venom gland;
RX   PubMed=16793192; DOI=10.1016/j.biochi.2006.05.003;
RA   Wei J.-F., Li T., Wei X.-L., Sun Q.-Y., Yang F.-M., Chen Q.-Y.,
RA   Wang W.-Y., Xiong Y.-L., He S.-H.;
RT   "Purification, characterization and cytokine release function of a
RT   novel Arg-49 phospholipase A(2) from the venom of Protobothrops
RT   mucrosquamatus.";
RL   Biochimie 88:1331-1342(2006).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Snake venom phospholipase A2 homolog that exhibits
CC       potent myotoxicity causing myonecrosis and myoedema in the
CC       gastrocnemius muscle of mice. Is also able to stimulate the
CC       release of IL12 (IL12A-IL12B), TNF-alpha (TNF), IL6 and IL1-beta
CC       (IL1B) from human monocytes, and induce IL2, TNFalpha and IL6
CC       release from T-cells. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16793192}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homodimer. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16793192}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed by the venom gland.
CC   -!- MASS SPECTROMETRY: Mass=13656; Method=MALDI; Range=17-138;
CC       Evidence={ECO:0000269|PubMed:16793192};
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: Fails to induce platelet aggregation, and has
CC       little effect on the ADP-induced platelet aggregation. Does not
CC       show hemorrhagic activity (PubMed:16793192).
CC       {ECO:0000305|PubMed:16793192}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the phospholipase A2 family. Group II
CC       subfamily. R49 sub-subfamily. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- CAUTION: Does not bind calcium as one of the calcium-binding
CC       ligands is lost (Asp->Arg in position 64, which corresponds to
CC       'Arg-49' in the current nomenclature). {ECO:0000305}.

RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [MRNA], PROTEIN SEQUENCE OF 16-86; 88-123 AND
RP   129-145, CATALYTIC ACTIVITY, SUBUNIT, AND MASS SPECTROMETRY.
RC   TISSUE=Venom, and Venom gland;
RX   PubMed=10556514; DOI=10.1016/S0014-5793(99)01392-7;
RA   Conde R., Zamudio F.Z., Becerril B., Possani L.D.;
RT   "Phospholipin, a novel heterodimeric phospholipase A2 from Pandinus
RT   imperator scp6pion venom.";
RL   FEBS Lett. 460:447-450(1999).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Scorpion venom phosholipase A2 (PLA2) that contains
CC       enzymatic activity, but does not inhibit ryanodine receptors in
CC       contrary to imperatoxin-1, another heterodimer of P.imperator
CC       venom. PLA2 catalyzes the calcium-dependent hydrolysis of the 2-
CC       acyl groups in 3-sn-phosphoglycerides.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Phosphatidylcholine + H(2)O = 1-
CC       acylglycerophosphocholine + a carboxylate. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU10035, ECO:0000269|PubMed:10556514}.
CC   -!- COFACTOR:
CC       Name=Ca(2+); Xref=ChEBI:CHEBI:29108; Evidence={ECO:0000250};
CC       Note=Binds 1 Ca(2+) ion. {ECO:0000250};
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Heterodimer composed of a small subunit and a large
CC       subunit; disulfid-linked. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10556514}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed by the venom gland.
CC   -!- MASS SPECTROMETRY: Mass=14841.2; Method=MALDI; Range=16-123, 129-
CC       145; Evidence={ECO:0000269|PubMed:10556514};
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the phospholipase A2 family. Group III
CC       subfamily. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- CAUTION: The sequence signal is uncertain for 2 reasons. Firstly,
CC       it contains 2 consecutive basic residues (Arg) that may indicate
CC       that this segment corresponds to the message for translating an
CC       unknown third peptide or long propeptide. Secondly, it is not
CC       predicted by the predictive tools. {ECO:0000305}.

ID   PDH1_AGAXA              Reviewed;         600 AA.

DE   RecName: Full=Pyranose dehydrogenase {ECO:0000303|PubMed:17227387};
DE            Short=PDH {ECO:0000303|PubMed:17227387};
DE            EC=1.1.99.29 {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17227387, ECO:0000269|PubMed:24970179};
DE   AltName: Full=Pyranose:quinone oxidoreductase 1 {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q3L245};
